title: Data Analyst
description: Since its inception, The Parking Spot has made superior airport parking experiences easy and affordable by focusing on hospitality. Now with more than 20 years in business, The Parking Spot has cemented itself as the leading near-airport Parking Company with 38 locations at 21 airports, and over 1,500 employees nationwide.<br><br>What makes working at The Parking Spot so special? We have created a culture of support, fun, and camaraderie that allows us to be the most innovative company in the parking industry. As a nationwide business with a small business feel, there are endless opportunities within The Parking Spot to grow your career. Come join us and see how we leverage people and technology to deliver a superior product, outshine our competition, and find creative and innovative solutions to everyday problems.<br><br><strong>What We Offer<br><br></strong><ul><li>Hybrid work environment with a flexible schedule</li><li>Career development and growth opportunities</li><li>Ability to gain exposure to all areas of the business</li><li>Great benefits including Medical, Vision, Dental and a 401k plan</li><li>Team oriented, fun and friendly work environment</li><li>Immediate opportunity to make a large impact<br><br></li></ul><strong>Position Summary<br><br></strong>The <strong>Data Analyst</strong> will be a key contributor on our Revenue Strategy and Analytics team, collaborating with a variety of functional departments across the company to drive our core business goals and decision-making. We operate in a dynamic, high-volume business environment with millions of transactions, reservations, and loyalty members. As a Data Analyst at The Parking Spot, you will have the opportunity to make a significant impact on the business through your customer-oriented segmentation and attribution efforts. This position is perfect for a candidate with a passion for data, a creative analytical mind, and a strong technical foundation.<br><br><strong><em>Our offices are based in the heart of the Loop in downtown Chicago, but we are pleased to note that our Chicago office is operating on a hybrid work model (mix of in-office and remote work). <br><br></em></strong><strong>Key Responsibilities<br><br></strong><ul><li>Assess our business processes and how they support our company goals</li><li>Collaborate with different functional areas on major technical and analytical projects</li><li>Design and develop new data pipelines to automate generation of analyses</li><li>Perform exploratory analyses using relevant business questions, particularly related to client and consumer behavior</li><li>Present and communicate results of analyses to the management team and stakeholders<br><br></li></ul><strong>Knowledge, Skills &amp; Experience Required<br><br></strong><ul><li>4-year BA/BS college degree</li><li>2+ years of professional business and/or data analysis experience</li><li>Proficiency using SQL to create, transform, and access data</li><li>Proficiency using Tableau for complex visualizations</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft Office products, especially Excel and PowerPoint</li><li>Familiarity with Python and data-related packages is a plus</li><li>Demonstrated ability to distill large amounts of business data into actionable insights</li><li>Strong sense of curiosity, urgency, and excitement around challenging business questions</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to explain complex concepts and findings to diverse audiences<br><br></li></ul>______<br><br><strong>At The Parking Spot, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate and seek it. </strong> We believe a diverse, inclusive, and equitable company is one where all employees, partners, and customers are welcome, supported, and valued. As a company in the travel industry, we witness the power of bringing individuals from different backgrounds and communities together. We treat all others with dignity and respect and stand firmly against racism and discrimination in any form. We intentionally develop diverse teams and relationships to ensure all voices are heard and to foster equal opportunity for all. We are committed to listening, learning, and growing because we know that our work is never done.

As a company in the travel industry, we witness the power of bringing individuals from different backgrounds and communities together. We treat all others with dignity and respect and stand firmly against racism and discrimination in any form. We intentionally develop diverse teams and relationships to ensure all voices are heard and to foster equal opportunity for all. We are committed to listening, learning, and growing because we know that our work is never done.

title: Asset Verification Data Analyst
description: We are looking for an <strong>Asset Verification</strong> <strong>Data Analyst</strong> to conduct independent confirmations of financial data directly with various people, including examiners at a federal agency. Our Asset Verification unit is located in multiple client offices across the country but this role would be based in Chicago, IL.<br><br>What you will be doing<br><ul><li>Assisting examination staff in reviewing accounts and performing statistical sampling routines to derive representative samples of accounts</li><li>Reviewing, examining, analyzing, and interpreting accounting records and financial statements of firms being examined</li><li>Reconciling reports and financial data and identifying inconsistencies, irregularities, errors, and potential fraudulent activity</li><li>Performing asset confirmations per end user requirements using Microsoft Office software and a commercial-off-the-self (COTS) product</li><li>Providing input and guidance on best practices/user guides for the asset verification process including improvements to the account verification tool to enhance its effectiveness and user-friendliness<br><br></li></ul>What you <em>need</em> to be considered for this role (required)<br><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, economics, or related field</li><li>3+ years of relevant experience</li><li>Familiarity with Microsoft suite of products with intermediate to advanced skills in Excel</li><li>Experience analyzing large amount of data in proper manner</li><li>Experience generating clear and insightful reports with charts, graphs, and prose for the benefit of financial, legal, and/or enforcement personnel</li><li>Excellent customer service/communications skills</li><li>Willingness to go above and beyond the usual to get at the underlying behavior behind financial data</li><li>Ability to effectively and efficiently multi-task, prioritize, and meet deadlines with minimal supervision</li><li>Ability to maintain a high level of accuracy and attention to detail</li><li>Strong work ethic and ability to work collaboratively in a team environment</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills</li><li>U.S. Citizenship required (dual nationals not eligible)</li><li>Position will require a Public Trust background investigation<br><br></li></ul><strong>About Us<br><br></strong>Ascella Technologies, Inc. (Ascella) is a minority-owned, Small Business that was founded in 2002 with the mission to deliver value-added services and technology-based solutions that generate real results for Federal agencies. Since our founding, Ascella has provided a wide range of financial management, accounting, system, data analytics, optimization, Agile, and IT support services to various Federal agencies.<br><br>Ascella is continuously growing and looking for team members that can help us continue to deliver value-added technology-based solutions. Ascella’s continued success is a reflection of our passion for people. We hire individuals with valuable experiences, and we strive to place people in roles that let them fully utilize their talents and flourish. With Ascella, “Your Success is Our Commitment”.<br><br>What makes Ascella employees great<br><ul><li>Innovative Thinkers: From small suggestions to large goals, employee voices are heard and acknowledged. We encourage employees to come up with creative ideas and give everyone the opportunity to help us define how we do things. You will have the opportunity to solve real business problems and be challenged to come up with innovative solutions.</li><li>Lifelong learners: We value lifelong learners who are excited about professional development and personal growth. At Ascella, employees are part of a company and a culture that encourages continuous improvement of both the organization and our employees. You will work in a collaborative environment with an experienced, highly capable team that learns from each other, and you will be both challenged and supported in your efforts to learn and grow.</li><li>Customer-Centric: Ascella is committed to complete customer satisfaction on every project. Our employees provide our customers with excellent service, proactively coming up with solutions to current and anticipated needs. The customer experience is an integral part of our mission and values, and you will work alongside people who are focused and dedicated to the commitment of customer satisfaction. </li><li>Open Communicators: Transparency and communication are important to us at Ascella. We have an “open door” policy, and our employees ask questions and share information on a regular basis. We believe in aligning employee work with overall company objectives and being open about our strategic plan and what we are trying to achieve. We encourage regular feedback and appreciate employee input on what’s working and what’s not so we can initiate discussions about how to improve our processes.</li><li>Inclusive: At Ascella, we encourage and embrace diversity in our workforce. We are committed to being an inclusive organization where all employees feel valued, respected, and engaged. Our employees have an array of talents, ideas, and experiences that help foster creativity and innovation and drive our success.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Position:</strong> Asset Verification Analyst<br><br><strong>Location:</strong> Chicago, IL (Fully Remote)<br><br><strong>Base Compensation:</strong> $TBD, based on factors such as geographic location and experience<br><br><strong>Other Compensation:</strong> 4% contribution to 401(k), performance bonus, profit-sharing<br><br><strong>Paid Time Off:</strong> 16 days PTO/year, 11 holidays/year<br><br><strong>Benefits:</strong> Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Disability, 401(k)…and more<br><br><strong>Equal Employment Opportunity Statement<br><br></strong><em>Ascella Technologies is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no one should be discriminated against because of their differences, such as age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion or sexual orientation. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified candidates without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status or any other characteristic protected by law. Ascella Technologies is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.</em>

title: Data Analyst
description: If you are a SOC Analyst with experience, please read on!<br><br>Job requirements: Strong Security Background<br><br>Job Location: Tampa or Chicago hybrid, 3 days a week in office!<br><br>Job Title: SOC Security Analyst<br><br>We are a cutting edge fintech organization that is making the purchase, sell and transfer of cryptocurrencies available for everyone! We are extremely stable as we have been in business for 5+ years and have a valuation well over a billion dollars. This is the opportunity to get into a mid sized company while it is still early enough to make an impact! If you have ever wanted to work at the forefront of blockchain with the latest in technology. This is the role for you!<br><br>Top Reasons to Work with Us<br><br>Strong Compensation Package. Base + Bonus + RSU's<br><br>RSU's in a company that matters! We are valued at over a billion dollars and looking to IPO in the next 3-5 years. You are going to want a piece of that!<br><br>Great Company Benefits! Unlimited PTO, 401k ( w/ match), medical, vision, dental.<br><br>Incredible company culture! Everyone who works here loves working here.<br><br>Great leadership team. Our CEO is featured on multiple prestigious lists.<br><br>Voted onto Inc 5000 nation's fastest growing company lists.<br><br>What You Will Be Doing<br><br>Maintain the security of data and systems!<br><br>Be responsible for Security Event monitoring activities.<br><br>Stay up to date with new threats.<br><br>Help our security team hunt and identify security issues generated from the network.<br><br>What You Need for this Position<br><br>Strong experience as a SOC Analyst!<br><br>So, if you are a SOC Analyst with experience, please apply today!<br><br>Colorado employees will receive paid sick leave. For additional information about available benefits, please contact Keith Ellis<br><br><strong><u>Email Your Resume In Word To<br><br></u></strong>Looking forward to receiving your resume through our website and going over the position with you. Clicking apply is the best way to apply, but you may also:<br><br>Keith.Ellis@CyberCoders.com<br><ul><li>Please do NOT change the email subject line in any way. You must keep the JobID: linkedin : KE2-1725953L066 -- in the email subject line for your application to be considered.***<br></li></ul>Keith Ellis - Recruiting Manager - CyberCoders<br><br>Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.<br><br><strong>CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer<br><br></strong>All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.<br><br><strong>Your Right to Work</strong> – In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.<br><br>CyberCoders will consider for Employment in the City of Los Angeles qualified Applicants with Criminal Histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring (Ban the Box) Ordinance.<br><br>

title: SOC Analyst
description: <p>We are inviting professionals in high-growth industries who are thinking about their next move or looking for a new opportunity to join our expanding talent pool.<br><br><br></p><p><strong>The F4S Talent Pool is a pilot project designed to:<br><br></strong></p><ul><li>Help job seekers get discovered by our partners based on their anticipated hiring needs.</li><li>Provide optional support and resources for job seekers in their career endeavors.</li><li>Help individuals understand, and bring out the best in themselves and each other.</li></ul><p><br><br></p><p><strong>The F4S Talent Pool process:<br><br></strong></p><p>Once you express your interest, you will be asked to complete the F4S work style assessment which measures 48 key attitudes and motivations in the context of work. On completion, you will be automatically added to our growing talent pool and contacted as new opportunities arise.<br><br></p><p><br><br></p><p><strong>About Fingerprint For Success (F4S)<br><br></strong></p><p>Backed by 20+ years of research, F4S’s revolutionary predictive analytics have achieved over 90% reliability in forecasting personal and team motivations, behaviors, and performance. Ultimately, we help people find purpose and fulfillment at work, and help build and scale high performing teams.<br><br><br></p><p>Keep in mind, joining our talent pool does not guarantee a job offer. We aim to balance your technical skills with the results of your F4S work style assessment to match the hiring needs of our partners.<br><br></p><p><br>Your feedback is a gift! Write to us via: hello@f4s.com to help co-create the future of recruitment, together.<br><br></p>

On completion, you will be automatically added to our growing talent pool and contacted as new opportunities arise.<br><br></p><p><br><br></p><p><strong>About Fingerprint For Success (F4S)<br><br></strong></p><p>Backed by 20+ years of research, F4S’s revolutionary predictive analytics have achieved over 90% reliability in forecasting personal and team motivations, behaviors, and performance. title: Expression of Interest: Data Engineer
description: <strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong>Consider this immediate opportunity for a talented and professional Chicago, Illinois Systems Engineer! This position requires you to serve as a key contributor to the maintenance and optimization of the client's network and wireless infrastructure. This is a short-term contract / temporary opportunity. Please apply right away!<br><br>Your responsibilities<br><ul><li> Direct and supervise all installed systems and infrastructure</li><li> Be involved the design of information and operational support systems</li><li> Survey and sample application performance for potential bottlenecks, pinpoint possible solutions, and cooperate with developers to perform those fixes</li><li> Be actively involved to assure the highest levels of systems and infrastructure availability</li><li> Compose and sustain custom scripts to increase system efficiency and lower the human intervention time on any tasks</li><li> Work together with vendors and other IT personnel for problem resolution</li><li> Manage redundancy strategies, security, and backup</li><li> Give 2nd and 3rd level support</li><li> Configure, test, maintain, and install operating systems, system management tools, and application software<br></li></ul><strong><u>Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li> Applicants who have experience with automation software are preferred</li><li> MCSE Certification experience</li><li> Solid understanding of MCSE</li><li> Applicants who have experience with virtualization and containerization are preferred</li><li> Applicants who have experience with monitoring systems are preferred</li><li> You'll be a good fit for this position if you have solid networking knowledge</li><li> You might be a good fit for this position if you have proven working experience in installing, configuring and troubleshooting various operating systems</li><li> Candidates who have solid scripting skills will be the best fit for this position</li><li> Solid experience in the administration and performance tuning of application stacks<br></li></ul>Technology Doesn't Change the World, People Do.®<br><br>Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.<br><br>Robert Half puts you in the best position to succeed by advocating on your behalf and promoting you to employers. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity – even on the go.<br><br>All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Benefits are available to contract/temporary professionals, including medical, vision, dental, and life and disability insurance. Hired contract/temporary professionals are also eligible to enroll in our company 401(k) plan. Visit<br><br>© 2023 Robert Half. An Equal Opportunity Employer. M/F/Disability/Veterans. By clicking “Apply Now,” you’re agreeing to

Please apply right away!<br><br>Your responsibilities<br><ul><li> Direct and supervise all installed systems and infrastructure</li><li> Be involved the design of information and operational support systems</li><li> Survey and sample application performance for potential bottlenecks, pinpoint possible solutions, and cooperate with developers to perform those fixes</li><li> Be actively involved to assure the highest levels of systems and infrastructure availability</li><li> Compose and sustain custom scripts to increase system efficiency and lower the human intervention time on any tasks</li><li> Work together with vendors and other IT personnel for problem resolution</li><li> Manage redundancy strategies, security, and backup</li><li> Give 2nd and 3rd level support</li><li> Configure, test, maintain, and install operating systems, system management tools, and application software<br></li></ul><strong><u>Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li> Applicants who have experience with automation software are preferred</li><li> MCSE Certification experience</li><li> Solid understanding of MCSE</li><li> Applicants who have experience with virtualization and containerization are preferred</li><li> Applicants who have experience with monitoring systems are preferred</li><li> You'll be a good fit for this position if you have solid networking knowledge</li><li> You might be a good fit for this position if you have proven working experience in installing, configuring and troubleshooting various operating systems</li><li> Candidates who have solid scripting skills will be the best fit for this position</li><li> Solid experience in the administration and performance tuning of application stacks<br></li></ul>Technology Doesn't Change the World, People Do.®<br><br>Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.<br><br>Robert Half puts you in the best position to succeed by advocating on your behalf and promoting you to employers. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity – even on the go.<br><br>All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Benefits are available to contract/temporary professionals, including medical, vision, dental, and life and disability insurance. Hired contract/temporary professionals are also eligible to enroll in our company 401(k) plan. Visit<br><br>© 2023 Robert Half. An Equal Opportunity Employer. M/F/Disability/Veterans. title: Systems Engineer
description: <strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong>LaSalle Network is currently hiring a<strong> Contact Center Analyst </strong>for a rapidly growing firm in downtown Chicago. This firm has been recognized by reputable publications as an up-and-coming leader in the legal industry and are growing their Chicago headquarters at a rapid pace!<br><br>As a<strong> Contact Center Analyst, </strong> you will support their contact center operations with an emphasis on business metrics, performance improvement, workforce management forecasting, staffing to optimize service levels and CCaaS system implementation. The right candidate will be able to take initiative, seek out root causes and explain business performance in a fast-paced environment.<br><br><strong><u>Call Center Analyst Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Review, combine, filter, analyze and leverage data from multiple sources to ensure continuous improvement of service performance </li><li> Utilize data findings and analysis to identify process gaps and opportunities for increased service levels </li><li> Responsible for leading, monitoring and distributing reporting and analytics to leadership team and other business partners </li><li> Facilitate frequent and regular meetings with leadership to maintain working relationships, ensuring data needs are met </li><li> Quantify the impact of business initiatives by partnering with all levels of the organization </li><li> Develop processes, procedures and methodologies that result in accurate and timely forecasts and can be used for both short and long-term budget and staff/capacity planning <br></li></ul><strong><u>Contact Center Analyst Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li> Excellent oral presentation skills with the ability to demonstrate clear communication skills </li><li> Ability to take initiative, seek out root causes and explain business performance </li><li> Strong analytical skills, adept data mining, data analysis and data presentation </li><li> College degree required </li><li> Experienced in IVR system design </li><li> 1-3 years of call center analytics experience and/or business forecasting strongly preferred <br></li></ul>Thank you,<br><br>Allison Sachnoff<br><br>Senior Project Manager<br><br>LaSalle Network<br><br><strong> Keywords and Related Terms: </strong> contact center analyst , call center analyst , CCaaS , analyst<br><br>LaSalle Network is an Equal Opportunity Employer m/f/d/v.<br><br>LaSalle Network is the leading provider of direct hire and temporary staffing services. For over two decades, LaSalle has helped organizations hire faster and connect top talent with opportunities, from entry-level positions to the C-suite. With units specializing in Accounting and Finance, Administrative, Marketing, Technology, Supply chain, Healthcare Revenue Cycle, Call Center, Human Resources and Executive Search. LaSalle offers staffing and recruiting solutions to companies of all sizes and across all industries. LaSalle Network is the premier staffing and recruiting firm, earning over 100 culture, revenue and industry-based awards from major publications and having its company experts regularly contribute insights on retention strategies, hiring trends and hiring challenges, and more to national news outlets.<br><br>

title: Contact Center Analyst
description: <strong>Global Financial Firm located in Elk Grove Village, IL has an immediate contract opportunity for an experienced SAS Programmer</strong><p><br></p><em>"This role is currently on a Hybrid Schedule. </em><p><br></p><em><em>You will need to have reliable internet, computer and android or </em> iphone<em> for remote access into the client systems during remote work.<br><br></em><em>We will be expected in the office weekly 2-3 days depending on the team requirement.<br></em><ul><li>Video/ f2f interviews are required prior to all offers. <br></li></ul>The focus this time is a little different than the previous role. We are effectively looking for a SAS programmer who is interested in testing and helping establish a SAS testing environment.<br><br>This position is for a senior tester who will interpret requirements and perform contextual business focused testing. The test analyst will work with the business analyst to build integration, regression, and functional tests. The candidate must exhibit testing concepts, strong communication skills and have flexibility to handle a dynamic work environment. Must be capable of working independently and collaboratively.<br><br><strong><u>Key Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Review requirements, specifications and technical design documents then translate them into functional level test requirements</li><li> Create detailed, comprehensive, and well-structured test approach and estimate the test effort</li><li> Document and prioritize test conditions and test scenarios</li><li> Execute test cases in a formal testing environment to identify, log, and track defects</li><li> Support data conditioning for E2E including other domain integration testing</li><li> Ability to prioritize work and flexibility to adapt to shifting priorities</li><li> Collaborate and communicate with multiple teams to triage technical issues</li><li> Identify opportunities and implement changes to increase testing automation and testing depth<br></li></ul>Qualification<br><ul><li> Knowledge of SAS language and ability to create small to intermediate SAS programs</li><li> Strong working knowledge of UNIX command line and ability to create UNIX shell scripts in Korn Shell</li><li> Have a technical background working as a programmer or tester for more than 5 years</li><li> Strong understanding of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), testing methodologies, tools and processes.</li><li> Strong with basic SQL queries to deal with backend testing</li><li> Knowledge of Autosys or other job scheduler</li><li> Knowledge of ETL processes</li><li> Working knowledge of test management software tool like Microfocus ALM/Quality Center</li><li> Strong communication skills with the ability to research, problem solve, and work independently</li><li> BA/BS in a technical field</li><li> Experience working with mainframe systems a plus</li><li> Knowledge of the Credit Card Industry is a plus</li><li> Experience with Credit Bureau attributes is a plus</li><li> Experience building/enhancing/maintaining an automated regression test suite is a plus</li></ul></em>

title: SAS Programmer*
description: <p>We are inviting professionals in high-growth industries who are thinking about their next move or looking for a new opportunity to join our expanding talent pool.<br><br><br></p><p><strong>The F4S Talent Pool is a pilot project designed to:<br><br></strong></p><ul><li>Help job seekers get discovered by our partners based on their anticipated hiring needs.</li><li>Provide optional support and resources for job seekers in their career endeavors.</li><li>Help individuals understand, and bring out the best in themselves and each other.<br></li></ul><p><strong>The F4S Talent Pool process:<br><br></strong></p><p>Once you express your interest, you will be asked to complete the F4S work style assessment which measures 48 key attitudes and motivations in the context of work. On completion, you will be automatically added to our growing talent pool and contacted as new opportunities arise.<br><br></p><p><br><br></p><p><strong>About Fingerprint For Success (F4S)<br><br></strong></p><p>Backed by 20+ years of research, F4S’s revolutionary predictive analytics have achieved over 90% reliability in forecasting personal and team motivations, behaviors, and performance. Ultimately, we help people find purpose and fulfillment at work, and help build and scale high performing teams.<br><br><br></p><p>Keep in mind, joining our talent pool does not guarantee a job offer. We aim to balance your technical skills with the results of your F4S work style assessment to match the hiring needs of our partners.<br><br></p><p><br>Your feedback is a gift! Write to us via: hello@f4s.com to help co-create the future of recruitment, together.<br><br></p>

title: SAS Programmer
description: <ul><li>Join the largest minority owned firm in the US with over 40B in assets managed|Within 5-10 years step into CIO role<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>Our client is a predominantly credit focused investment management firm that has been around for over 2 decades. They are a nice, family friendly firm rooted in philanthropy and giving back to the community. Their culture and investment process are rooted in three defining principles: rigorous fundamental analysis, strong risk management, and ongoing portfolio optimization.<br><br>Our client is based in Chicago and have assets under management of approximately $5 billion. Our client recently was acquired by a new entity, and they will be the investment manager for all assets going into this entity. This will lead them to growth of approx. $40 billion in assets under management, and the largest minority owned financial firm in the world.<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong><ul><li>Work with stakeholders to identify and analyze business requirements, develop solutions, and create technical designs.</li><li>Provide technical guidance and leadership to the junior members of the data analytics team, ensuring that the solutions are built according to best practices.</li><li>Own and improve the data platform architecture</li><li>Evaluate new technologies and integrate them into our infrastructure</li><li>Lead the design of improved data flows, data architecture, and data solutions</li><li>Help build out a secure and highly available data system to scale</li><li>Help create and build front office data analytics tools and automation processe<br><br></li></ul><em>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br></em><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong><ul><li>7+ years of experience developing, designing and supporting applications at a financial institution</li><li>In-depth knowledge of data architecture best practices, such as data modeling, database design, and data integration</li><li>Proven track record of designing and deploying data architectures with scalability and performance in mind</li><li>Ability to create and maintain comprehensive documentation for data architecture solutions</li><li>Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to design and troubleshoot complex technical problems</li><li>Proficiency in programming languages such as SQL, Python, C# and/or Tableau</li><li>Experience with cloud-based data architectures, such as AWS and Azure</li><li>Knowledge of data security principles and regulations</li><li>Strong communication and interpersonal skills for working with stakeholders across the organization</li><li>Automating of processes and analytics and the technologies that enable automation</li></ul><strong>What's on Offer<br></strong><ul><li>Highly competetive base salary up to 190K with a 50-75% bonus</li><li>Flexibility to work from home when needed</li><li>Paternity/Maternity Leave</li><li>Comprehensive healthcare</li><li>Short-term/Long-term disability<br></li></ul><strong>Contact: Daniela Rodríguez Flores<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-052023-6050687</strong>

title: Software/Data Engineer - Python/C#/Java
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>As an Adobe Implementation Specialist, you will be part of DNA Marketing Technology team, serving teams that engage with customers and prospects throughout the customer journey, from acquisition marketing to portfolio collections to digital app experience across Discover. You will work with DNA Martech Engineers, Data collections product owners, Business stakeholders and Data Scientists to design, develop and implement technical tagging requirements for company web and mobile app platforms.<p><br></p>You will lead the design and implementation of MarTech solutions with a focus on Adobe Analytics, Adobe Launch and AEP. You will be a liaison between the Adobe Analytics analysts, launch implementation developers, and data layer developers, owning projects to ensure tagging is complete and accurate. You will have the opportunity to work on solutions that drive business value for improved analysis, storytelling, and customer journey development.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develops and leads an Agile team focused on next-generation data and analytic technologies.</li><li>Provides technical consulting in support of the creation and enhancement of analytical platforms and tools.</li><li>Provides technical consulting to application development teams during application design and development for highly complex and critical data projects.</li><li>Partners on a team to deliver data projects, including migration to new data technologies for unstructured, streaming, and high-volume data.</li><li>Develops and deploys big data applications.</li><li>Builds and administers large scale data platforms. Integrates next-generation data analytic tools into the big data ecosystem.</li><li>Responsible for architecting, configuring, and administering an analytics infrastructure in partnership with Product, Design, and IT Development.</li><li>Debugs/troubleshoots/resolves Adobe configuration and integration issues.</li><li>Assess, audit and identify gaps in existing tagging, infrastructure and Adobe Launch configurations.</li><li>Develops and document Discover MarTech’s data collection standards and best practices.</li><li>Support implementation architecture strategy and governance</li><li>Develops instrumentation strategies across multiple websites &amp; mobile apps.</li><li>Provides guidance and mentorship to the development team to ensure high-quality code and adherence to coding standards.<br><br></li></ul><ul><li>Responsible for the following tasks:</li><ul><li>Tagging for both websites &amp; native mobile apps in enterprise-grade environments</li><li>Tagging schemas and specifications for new sites and new site features</li><li>Quality Assurance and debugging of tagging as implemented by engineers.</li><li>Data layer design description_json: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>As an Adobe Implementation Specialist, you will be part of DNA Marketing Technology team, serving teams that engage with customers and prospects throughout the customer journey, from acquisition marketing to portfolio collections to digital app experience across Discover. You will work with DNA Martech Engineers, Data collections product owners, Business stakeholders and Data Scientists to design, develop and implement technical tagging requirements for company web and mobile app platforms.<p><br></p>You will lead the design and implementation of MarTech solutions with a focus on Adobe Analytics, Adobe Launch and AEP. You will be a liaison between the Adobe Analytics analysts, launch implementation developers, and data layer developers, owning projects to ensure tagging is complete and accurate. You will have the opportunity to work on solutions that drive business value for improved analysis, storytelling, and customer journey development.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develops and leads an Agile team focused on next-generation data and analytic technologies.</li><li>Provides technical consulting in support of the creation and enhancement of analytical platforms and tools.</li><li>Provides technical consulting to application development teams during application design and development for highly complex and critical data projects.</li><li>Partners on a team to deliver data projects, including migration to new data technologies for unstructured, streaming, and high-volume data.</li><li>Develops and deploys big data applications.</li><li>Builds and administers large scale data platforms. Integrates next-generation data analytic tools into the big data ecosystem.</li><li>Responsible for architecting, configuring, and administering an analytics infrastructure in partnership with Product, Design, and IT Development.</li><li>Debugs/troubleshoots/resolves Adobe configuration and integration issues.</li><li>Assess, audit and identify gaps in existing tagging, infrastructure and Adobe Launch configurations.</li><li>Develops and document Discover MarTech’s data collection standards and best practices.</li><li>Support implementation architecture strategy and governance</li><li>Develops instrumentation strategies across multiple websites &amp; mobile apps.</li><li>Provides guidance and mentorship to the development team to ensure high-quality code and adherence to coding standards.<br><br></li></ul><ul><li>Responsible for the following tasks:</li><ul><li>Tagging for both websites &amp; native mobile apps in enterprise-grade environments</li><li>Tagging schemas and specifications for new sites and new site features</li><li>Quality Assurance and debugging of tagging as implemented by engineers.</li><li>Data layer design and implementation</li><li>Writing tagging specifications for engineers.<br><br></li></ul></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need lieu of a degree, 6+ years of experience in Data Platform Administration, Engineering, or related field</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>If we had our title: Adobe Implementation Specialist
description: <strong>Our Story </strong><p><br></p>Founded in 2008, Hightower is a wealth management firm that provides investment, financial and retirement planning services to individuals, foundations and family offices, as well as 401(k) consulting and cash management services to corporations. Hightower’s capital solutions, operational support services, size and scale empower its vibrant community of independent-minded wealth advisors to grow their businesses and help their clients achieve their vision of “well-th. rebalanced.” Based in Chicago with advisors across the U.S., we operate as a registered investment advisor (RIA).<p><br></p>Our commitment to our culture is demonstrated every day through the Hightower Way. By joining Hightower, you will build a community of inclusive relationships, take proactive ownership, embrace others’ perspectives, and have an uncompromising dedication to excellence.<p><br></p><strong> Your Future Team</strong><p><br></p>The Hightower Platform and Innovation group is growing and looking to add an Email Security Engineer, to work directly within the Technology Infrastructure team. This team is responsible for the firms; local/cloud, network, and unified communications infrastructure.<p><br></p><strong>What You’ll Do</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Serve as a Hightower brand ambassador by upholding The Hightower Way cultural elements – Mission, Purpose, V.A.L.U.E. Experience, Commitment and Standards, promoting excellence in the internal and external client experience during every encounter </li><li> Improve consistency in every client and colleague encounter by embodying the core principles of our Hightower V.A.L.U.E. Experience (Validate, Actively Listen, Leverage Resources, Understand Ownership, Express Gratitude) </li><li> Partner with cross-discipline team members to support collaboration and promote a positive client experience </li><li> Domain and Certificate management, &gt; 120 and growing domains </li><li> Act as the contact for resolving Email Security System operational tickets ensuring resolution as per defined SLAs </li><li> Monitor email traffic and respond to security alerts </li><li> Troubleshoot issues related to non-delivery of email related arising from Data Loss Prevention, intrusion and threat prevention </li><li> Ensure the Email security platform is configured and updated with heightened Cyber Security features and rules </li><li> Create Standard Operating Procedures and other similar documentation </li><li> Help implement counter-measures or mitigating control for email security issues <br><br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You’ll Bring</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Minimum 3 years of IT/email security experience in enterprise environments </li><li> Minimum 3 years of experience working with email threat prevention platforms in complex email delivery systems </li><li> In-depth knowledge of DNS, SMTP, DMARC, DKIM, and SPF </li><li> In-depth knowledge of Microsoft 365 online email and Secure Email Gateway such as Proofpoint Security Platform </li><li> In-depth knowledge of message archiving and compliance management </li><li> Proficient in the use of automation tools, configuration management solutions, DevOps principles, and data analytics </li><li> Working experience integrating SaaS services and APIs </li><li> Familiarity with the CI/CD process </li><li> Experience with Cloud architecture </li><li> Familiarity with Azure; Platform, AD, Graph API </li><li> Familiarity with scripting and using scripting languages (Python, Powershell) </li><li> Security and cloud certifications (CISSP, CCSP, AWS, Azure) <br><br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What We Offer</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Coverage on the first day of employment for Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance </li><li> Paid Parental Leave (16 weeks for primary caregiver and 8 weeks for secondary caregiver) </li><li> Flexible PTO Plan </li><li> Hybrid Model Work Schedule (50% in office) </li><li> 401k Matching Plan </li><li> HSA Employer Contributions </li><li> Student Loan Assistance </li><li> Pet Insurance </li><li> We commit to a transparent, people-first environment where talent is maximized through our diverse, equitable and inclusive community </li><li> We nurture a spirit of belonging, are energized by challenges, celebrate our successes, and achieve individual and collective well-th goals <br><br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong> AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER: </strong> Hightower is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based upon race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, national origin, citizenship, veteran status, ancestry, age (over 40), physical or mental disability, medical condition (cancer-related), gender identity or expression, genetic information including sickle cell or hemoglobin C trait, or any other consideration made unlawful by applicable federal, state, or local law.<p><br></p><em> You are a U.S. citizen, U.S. permanent resident or possess other unrestricted U.S. work authorization and will not require sponsorship for U.S. work authorization now or anytime in the future. </em><p><br></p>Apply Now

description: <strong>Requisition ID: </strong>87650<p><br></p><strong>Job Category: </strong>Engineering; Campus<p><br></p><strong>Location: </strong>Chicago, IL, United States<p><br></p>Join a company that is passionately committed to the pursuit of a better world through positive change. With more than 65 years of business and technical expertise in mining , energy , and infrastructure , our 10,000 colleagues in 150 countries tirelessly work toward bettering the industries in which we operate. With practical solutions that are safe, innovative and sustainable, we think globally while acting locally. Are you looking for an opportunity to join a diverse group of professionals who are committed to remaining exceptional? We look forward to hearing from you.<p><br></p>Our expertise in infrastructure includes aviation, highways and bridges, planning and advisory services, ports, rail and transit, tunnels, and water. Want to be part of the creation and construction of our cities? Then the infrastructure team is for you!<p><br></p>Hatch is currently seeking <strong>2023 GRADUATING STUDENTS</strong> for a highly motivated Junior Rail Systems Engineer - Communications and IT Infrastructure to join our Rail Systems Engineering group in Hatch Chicago, IL office.<p><br></p><strong>In this role, the ideal candidate is an electrical or computer engineer with excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to work well in a team environment. Candidates must have knowledge of core electrical and/or computer engineering concepts and have a minimum of 0-2 years of professional engineering experience. Any experience working in the rail industry is a bonus. An EIT registration is desirable, but not required.</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>A transcript is REQUIRED to be considered</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>As a Successful Candidate, You Will</u></strong><p><br></p>Work with an elite group of rail systems design professionals focusing on North American projects, with opportunities in both the heavy rail and transit markets<p><br></p>Participate in design, testing, and commissioning activities on various transportation projects with focus on communications and IT infrastructure<p><br></p>Collaborate with team members locally and globally to accomplish project objectives<p><br></p><strong><u>You Bring To The Role</u></strong><p><br></p>A Bachelor's degree in Computer or Electrical Engineering or related discipline<p><br></p>A minimum of 0-2 years of engineering experience<p><br></p>Experience involving software development, electronics, networks, or multi-system integration<p><br></p>Excellent analytical, written, and oral communication skills<p><br></p>Demonstrate strong organizational skills, work well within a team, take direction from other senior staff members, be able to multi-task on a variety of work assignments, and meet deadlines.<p><br></p>Solve unique problems through self-motivated learning and research<p><br></p>Familiarity with technical writing and drafting software tools<p><br></p><strong><u>The Following Skills/experience Are a Plus</u></strong><p><br></p>EIT certificate<p><br></p><strong><u>Highly Developed Analytical Skills And Hands-on Experience</u></strong><p><br></p>Field testing<p><br></p>CAD<p><br></p>Why join us?<p><br></p>Be part of a great team<p><br></p>Develop innovation partnerships<p><br></p>Engage with people who make a difference<p><br></p>What we offer you?<p><br></p>Flexible work environment<p><br></p>Long term career development<p><br></p>Why join us?<p><br></p><ul><li>Work with great people to make a difference</li><li>Collaborate on exciting projects to develop innovative solutions</li><li> Top employer </li></ul><p><br></p>What we offer you?<p><br></p><ul><li>Flexible work environment</li><li>Long term career development</li><li>Think globally, work locally</li></ul><p><br></p>Don't meet every single requirement? You don't need to. At Hatch, we are building a diverse, inclusive workplace that fosters innovation. If you're interested in this role, we encourage you to apply even if your past experiences don't perfectly align with the skills we've listed.<p><br></p>We're committed to fostering a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we operate and serve. Hatch is an Equal Opportunity Employer that considers applicants without regard to age, race, color, national origin, citizenship, religion, creed, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, veteran, or any other protected status. If you have any accommodation requirements, please let us know. We'll do our best to meet your needs in accordance with applicable local legislation.<p><br></p>[[req_postHashtag]]

description: A client in the Greater Chicago area is seeking a Systems/Networking Engineer to join their team. In this role you will manage and maintain Windows servers, ensuring optimal performance, security, and availability. You will configure, monitor, and troubleshoot network infrastructure, and you will provide technical support and assistance to end-users, resolving issues related to systems, networks, and connectivity. This is a full time, direct hire role.<br><br><strong>Location:</strong> Hybrid in the Great Chicago area (on site 3x/wk)<br><br><strong>Salary: </strong>Up to 120K DOE<br><br><strong><u>Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>Proven experience as a Systems/Networking Engineer in a Windows environment </li><li>Strong knowledge of Windows servers, VMware, and Active Directory administration </li><li>Familiarity with network protocols, routing, and switching. </li><li>Experience in configuring and troubleshooting VPNs and firewalls </li><li>Solid understanding of network security principles and best practices <br></li></ul><strong><u>Pluses<br></u></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field </li><li>CCNA/CCNP certification\<br></li></ul>indsepchi2hi

In this role you will manage and maintain Windows servers, ensuring optimal performance, security, and availability. You will configure, monitor, and troubleshoot network infrastructure, and you will provide technical support and assistance to end-users, resolving issues related to systems, networks, and connectivity. This is a full time, direct hire role.<br><br><strong>Location:</strong> Hybrid in the Great Chicago area (on site 3x/wk)<br><br><strong>Salary: </strong>Up to 120K DOE<br><br><strong><u>Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>Proven experience as a Systems/Networking Engineer in a Windows environment </li><li>Strong knowledge of Windows servers, VMware, and Active Directory administration </li><li>Familiarity with network protocols, routing, and switching. </li><li>Experience in configuring and troubleshooting VPNs and firewalls </li><li>Solid understanding of network security principles and best practices <br></li></ul><strong><u>Pluses<br></u></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field </li><li>CCNA/CCNP certification\<br></li></ul>indsepchi2hi

title: Systems/Networking Engineer
description: <strong>About ONE<br><br></strong>ONE is on a mission to help people live healthier financial lives. We’re doing this by creating simple solutions to help our customers save, spend, and grow their money – all in one place.<br><br>The U.S. consumer today deserves better. Millions of Americans today can’t access credit, build savings or wealth, and are left to manage their financial lives through multiple disconnected apps. Almost a quarter of U.S. adults are unbanked or underbanked and roughly 80% of fintech users rely on multiple accounts to manage their finances.<br><br>What makes us unique? We are backed by a preeminent fintech investor (Ribbit) and the world’s largest retailer (Walmart), maintain the speed and independence of a startup, and employ a strong (and growing) collection of world-class talent.<br><br>There’s never been a better moment to build a business that helps people live healthier financial lives. Come build with us!<br><br>The role<br><br>As Performance Testing, your mandate is to guarantee that ONE’s applications and services can scale to tens of millions of customers while maintaining our high standards of quality in customer experience and reliability. This role will impact ONE’s vision by taking performance concerns to the next level, This role will work with Engineering Leadership to develop and manage our Performance Testing function in a way that enables our talented Engineering org to meet business case requirements and industry standards for speed, scalability, and sustainability. This role reports to the Head of Platform Engineering.<br><br>This role is responsible for:<br><ul><li>Develop a performance testing program to support long-term application reliability and growth</li><li>Identity metrics and targets that merge industry best practices with ONE’s system architecture</li><li>Work closely with the platform, infra, and bank ops engineering teams (and others) to define and spin up infrastructure and processes to support testing plans</li><li>Collaborate cross-functionally with product and business teams to keep our testing strategy up to date with an always-evolving product and operational roadmap</li><li>Conduct regular system performance tests and tracking trends and risks against business goals</li><li>Deliver detailed and actionable reports on performance testing results to our internal teams</li><li>Additional duties as assigned by your manager<br><br></li></ul>You bring<br><ul><li>5+ Years experience. A big plus if you also bring at least 2+ years leading technical initiatives</li><li>An act-like-an-owner mentality. We have a bias toward taking action.</li><li>Experience testing modern systems backed by legacy systems</li><li>A willingness to dive in and contribute as an individual to build a great toolset and team at the same time</li><li>An understanding of the challenges involved in testing financial services products<br><br></li></ul>Pay Transparency<br><br>The estimated annual base salary for this position ranges from $190,000 to $205,000. Pay is generally based upon the level, complexity, responsibility, and job duties / requirements of the specific position. We then source candidates with the requisite skills, expertise, education, training, and experience. If you are selected for an interview, please feel welcome to speak to a Talent Partner about our compensation philosophy and other available benefits.<br><br>What it’s like working @ ONE<br><br>Our teams collaborate remotely and in our work spaces in New York and Sacramento.<br><ul><li>Competitive cash - we don’t discount based on location</li><li>Benefits effective on day one </li><li>Early access to a high potential, high growth fintech</li><li>Generous stock option packages in an early-stage startup</li><li>Remote friendly (anywhere in the US) and office friendly - you pick the schedule</li><li>Flexible time off programs - vacation, sick, paid parental leave, and paid caregiver leave</li><li>401(k) plan with match<br><br></li></ul>Leveling Philosophy<br><br>In order to thoughtfully scale the company and avoid downstream inequities, we’ve adopted a flat titling structure at ONE. Though we may occasionally post a role externally with a prefix such as “Senior” to reflect the external level of the position, we do not use prefixes in titles like that internally unless in a position which manages a team. Internal titles typically include your specific functional responsibility, such as engineering, product management or sales, and often include additional descriptors to ensure clarity of role and placement within our organization (i.e. “Engineer, Platform”, “Sales, Business Development” or “Manager, Talent”). Employees are paid commensurate with their experience and the internal level within ONE.<br><br>Inclusion &amp; Belonging<br><br>To build technology and products that are used and loved by people and solve real-world problems, we need to build a team with many different perspectives and experiences. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us. Email talent@one.app with any questions.<br><br>For additional questions around our interview process, please check out our Candidate FAQs.

title: Performance Test Engineer
description: Invenergy drives innovation in energy. Powered by decades of entrepreneurial experience and unparalleled execution, we solve the energy challenges facing our customers and communities. We provide power generation and storage solutions at scale around the world to create a cleaner energy future. We develop. We build. We own. We operate. We are Invenergy.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong><strong>Job Description<br></strong><ul><li>Provide first line technical expertise to Invenergy’s operating utility-scale wind energy facilities.</li><li>Identify, evaluate, and resolve equipment reliability and performance issues to maximize site energy production. Equipment includes wind turbine blades, gearboxes, and mechanical/electrical subsystems.</li><li>Interface with equipment manufacturers to resolve technical issues and develop best operating practices. </li><li>Develop procedures and technical documentation regarding the safe and efficient operation of wind facilities.</li><li>Participate in regular site operation calls and work with field personnel to investigate equipment issues and maximize production.</li><li>Lead innovative pilot projects to evaluate new equipment, tools, or processes.</li><li>Analyze inspection results, SCADA data, and controls logic to gain operational insights.</li><li>Work with the performance analytics team to develop new monitoring strategies and predictive analytics for wind facilities.</li><li>Work with the EHS team to develop safe operating practices and standards.</li><li>Support the start-up of operations at new facilities.</li><li>Support the end-of-warranty inspection process at facilities.</li><li>Some travel (&lt; 25%) and moderate field work may be required.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Required Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>B.S. in an engineering discipline, M.S. preferred</li><li>Three to six years’ work experience</li><li>Demonstrated interest in renewable energy systems</li><li>Strong interest and understanding of mechanical and electrical systems</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office products and able to quickly acclimate to new software</li><li>Ability to independently manage projects and drive initiatives</li><li>Experience with wind turbine, equipment reliability, or work management programs is a plus<br></li></ul><strong><u>Benefits<br><br></u></strong>Eligible for medical, dental, vision, 401(k), bonus, paid time off, etc.<br><br>Invenergy LLC is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, status as a protected veteran, or disability.

title: Availability Engineer II, Operations Engineering
description: <strong><u>Overview</u></strong><p><br></p>Houlihan Lokey (NYSE:HLI) is a global investment bank with expertise in mergers and acquisitions, capital markets, financial restructuring, and valuation. The firm serves corporations, institutions, and governments worldwide with offices in the United States, Europe, the Middle East, and the Asia-Pacific region. Independent advice and intellectual rigor are hallmarks of the firm’s commitment to client success across its advisory services. Houlihan Lokey is the No. 1 M&amp;A advisor for the past five consecutive years in the U.S., the No. 1 global restructuring advisor for the past six consecutive years, and the No. 1 global M&amp;A fairness opinion advisor over the past 20 years, all based on number of transactions and according to data provided by Refinitiv (formerly Thomson Reuters).<p><br></p><strong>Financial Valuation and Advisory</strong><p><br></p>Over the past 50 years, Houlihan Lokey has established one of the largest worldwide financial and valuation advisory practices. Our transaction expertise and leadership in the field of valuation inspire confidence in the financial executives, boards of directors, special committees, retained counsel, investors, and business owners we serve. In 2021, Refinitiv (formerly known as Thomson Reuters) ranked us the No. 1 U.S. M&amp;A fairness opinion advisor over the past 20 years. Our stability, integrity, technical leadership, and global capabilities make us a trusted advisor for clients worldwide, across a wide range of services, including the Transaction Opinions, Transaction Advisory Services, Corporate Valuation Advisory Services, Portfolio Valuation and Fund Advisory Services, Real Estate Valuation and Advisory Services, and Dispute Resolution Consulting practices.<p><br></p><strong>Real Estate Valuation and Advisory Services </strong><p><br></p>Houlihan Lokey’s Real Estate Valuation and Advisory Services practice (REVS) brings dedicated expertise to the unique challenges inherent in valuing real estate assets. Our seasoned team of real estate professionals has a distinguished history of valuing real estate companies and their underlying securities, large real estate portfolios, and individual properties.<p><br></p>The group is composed of credentialed industry professionals who hold the MAI designation awarded by the Appraisal Institute, Certified Public Accountants, as well as Accredited Senior Appraisers of the American Society of Appraisers (ASA) and professional members of the Royal Institute of Chartered Surveyors (MRICS and FRICS). Our capabilities go far beyond appraisal, with our REVS team regularly working alongside our Real Estate, Lodging &amp; Leisure Group (Corporate Finance/ Restructuring) to provide distinctive expertise in transaction execution. Such market intelligence empowers our REVS team to deliver real-time insight based on real-world transactional experience.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description - Financial Analyst</u></strong><p><br></p>Our Real Estate Valuation and Advisory Services (REVS) team is recruiting for a new Financial Analyst. We have availability in our Los Angeles, Chicago, Dallas and Atlanta offices. As a Financial Analyst, you will review and analyze complex real estate models, conduct market and financial research regarding real estate supply, demand, pricing and investment parameters; including in-market interviews, data gathering and confirmation of comparable transactions as well as utilizing data subscription sources. The Financial Analyst will work with other Analysts, Associates, and Officers to execute valuation advisory work, often in connection with high profile real estate transactions. You will work with many leading REITs, real estate private equity firms, and real estate operators, analyzing and valuing their investments for a variety of purposes.<p><br></p>The Financial Analyst will work with a highly talented and dedicated staff of professionals who will give broad exposure to the many different issues and concerns affecting real estate businesses and investors today. The environment at Houlihan Lokey is collegial and entrepreneurial and rewards Financial Analysts with substantial responsibility and interaction with senior-level professionals.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities &amp; Deliverables</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Work alongside Analysts, Associates, and Officers valuing commercial real estate investments across various asset classes (multifamily, retail, industrial, hospitality, and more).</li><li>Be actively involved in various client engagements, including valuation and advisory work related to investor and financial reporting, due diligence, and transaction opinions.</li><li>Collect, manipulate, and analyze property, market and financial data.</li><li>Acquire knowledge of the use and capabilities of subscription data sources and software, including Costar, REIS, Green Street, Real Capital Analytics, Marshall Valuation Services, ARGUS, etc.</li><li>Analyze historic property operating statements and analyze leases.</li><li>Assist Associates and Officers in the preparation of complex cash flow models using Excel and/or ARGUS software, including analyzing available data to estimate revenues, costs, and rates of return.</li><li>Estimate value of real estate investments at various levels of the capital stack, including asset-level valuations, equity valuations, preferred equity valuations, and debt valuations.</li><li>Prepare reports and presentations to team and clients, including graphic and written sections.</li><li>Assist in marketing pitches, real estate thought leadership articles, and other ad-hoc duties.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Basic Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>1-3 years of real estate industry experience, with a preference towards direct real estate valuation experience demonstrating analytical capabilities.</li><li>A strong interest in real estate advisory work (ie, valuation consulting).</li><li>COVID vaccination required, subject to applicable state and federal law.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p>Teamwork is essential to the firm’s success. At the same time, creativity and new ideas are encouraged. Analysts are given substantial responsibility and are encouraged to help us grow our business. The ideal candidate should be motivated, creative, outgoing, and possess strong financial analysis skills.<p><br></p><ul><li>Undergraduate coursework in real estate finance, real estate valuation, or related fields</li><li>Knowledge of real estate valuation theory, methodologies, and applications</li><li>Strong analytical abilities</li><li>Proficiency with Excel (particularly modeling skills, writing macros, etc.) and PowerPoint</li><li>Experience in ARGUS is strongly preferred</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Strong work ethic and attention to detail</li><li>Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment</li><li>Excellent organizational, problem solving and communication skills</li><li>Possession of or progress towards real estate industry certification licenses, such as MAI, CCIM, certified general real estate appraiser</li><li>CPA, CFA or other financial credential a plus</li><li>Willingness to travel</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description - Associate</u></strong><p><br></p>Our Real Estate Valuation and Advisory Services (REVS) team is recruiting for a new Associate. We have availability in our Los Angeles, Chicago, Dallas and Atlanta offices. As an Associate, you will conduct financial research, review and analyze complex real estate models, help lead client diligence calls, and work with other Analysts, Associates and Officers to execute valuation advisory work, often in connection with high-profile real estate transactions. You will work with many leading REITs, real estate private equity firms, and real estate operators, analyzing and valuing their investments for a variety of purposes.<p><br></p>The Associate will work with a highly talented and dedicated staff of professionals who will give broad exposure to the many different issues and concerns affecting real estate businesses and investors today. The environment at Houlihan Lokey is collegial and entrepreneurial and rewards Associates with substantial responsibility and interaction with senior-level professionals.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities &amp; Deliverables</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Work alongside Analysts, Associates, and Officers valuing commercial real estate investments across various asset classes (multifamily, retail, industrial, hospitality, and more).</li><li>Be actively involved in various client engagements, including valuation and advisory work related to investor and financial reporting, due diligence, and transaction opinions.</li><li>Collect, manipulate, and analyze property, market and financial data.</li><li>Acquire knowledge of the use and capabilities of subscription data sources and software, including Costar, REIS, Green Street, Real Capital Analytics, Marshall Valuation Services, ARGUS, etc.</li><li>Analyze historic property operating statements and analyze leases.</li><li>Assist Officers in the preparation of complex cash flow models using Excel and/or ARGUS software, including analyzing available data to estimate revenues, costs, and rates of return.</li><li>Estimate value of real estate investments at various levels of the capital stack, including asset-level valuations, equity valuations, preferred equity valuations, and debt valuations.</li><li>Prepare reports and presentations to team and clients, including graphic and written sections.</li><li>Review Analysts and Associates work products, providing real-time coaching on technical and real estate market matters.</li><li>Regularly present results from modeling and valuation projects directly to Officers and Clients.</li><li>Assist in marketing pitches, real estate thought leadership articles, and other ad-hoc duties.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Basic Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>3-5 years of direct real estate valuation experience demonstrating analytical capabilities.</li><li>A strong interest in real estate advisory work (ie, valuation consulting).</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p>Teamwork is essential to the firm’s success. At the same time, creativity and new ideas are encouraged. Associates are given substantial responsibility and are encouraged to help us grow our business. The ideal candidate should be motivated, creative, outgoing, and possess strong financial analysis skills.<p><br></p><ul><li>Undergraduate coursework in real estate finance, real estate valuation, or related fields</li><li>Strong understanding of real estate valuation theory, methodologies, and applications</li><li>Exceptional analytical abilities</li><li>Strong Excel modeling skills (e.g., waterfall calculations, building discounted cash flows, writing macros, etc.) and PowerPoint</li><li>Proficiency in ARGUS</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Strong work ethic and attention to detail</li><li>Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment</li><li>Excellent organizational, problem solving and communication skills</li><li>Possession of or progress towards real estate industry certification licenses, such as MAI, CCIM, certified general real estate appraiser</li><li>CPA, CFA or other financial credential a plus</li><li>Active participation in real estate industry organizations (e.g., Appraisal Institute, ULI, NCREIF, NAREIT) a plus</li><li>Willingness to travel</li></ul><p><br></p>We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.<p><br></p><strong><u>The Firm’s Good Faith And Reasonable Estimate Of The Possible Salary Range For This Role At The Time Of Posting Is</u></strong><p><br></p>Houlihan Lokey is committed to providing its employees with an exciting career opportunity and competitive total compensation package.<p><br></p>$85,000-$140,000<p><br></p>Actual salary at the time of hire may vary and may be above or below the range based on various factors, including, but not limited to, the candidate’s relevant qualifications, skills, and experience and the location where this position may be filled.<p><br></p><em><strong>We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.</strong></em>
