Deliverables</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Work alongside Analysts, Associates, and Officers valuing commercial real estate investments across various asset classes (multifamily, retail, industrial, hospitality, and more).</li><li>Be actively involved in various client engagements, including valuation and advisory work related to investor and financial reporting, due diligence, and transaction opinions.</li><li>Collect, manipulate, and analyze property, market and financial data.</li><li>Acquire knowledge of the use and capabilities of subscription data sources and software, including Costar, REIS, Green Street, Real Capital Analytics, Marshall Valuation Services, ARGUS, etc.</li><li>Analyze historic property operating statements and analyze leases.</li><li>Assist Associates and Officers in the preparation of complex cash flow models using Excel and/or ARGUS software, including analyzing available data to estimate revenues, costs, and rates of return.</li><li>Estimate value of real estate investments at various levels of the capital stack, including asset-level valuations, equity valuations, preferred equity valuations, and debt valuations.</li><li>Prepare reports and presentations to team and clients, including graphic and written sections.</li><li>Assist in marketing pitches, real estate thought leadership articles, and other ad-hoc duties.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Basic Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>1-3 years of real estate industry experience, with a preference towards direct real estate valuation experience demonstrating analytical capabilities.</li><li>A strong interest in real estate advisory work (ie, valuation consulting).</li><li>COVID vaccination required, subject to applicable state and federal law.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p>Teamwork is essential to the firm’s success. At the same time, creativity and new ideas are encouraged. Analysts are given substantial responsibility and are encouraged to help us grow our business. The ideal candidate should be motivated, creative, outgoing, and possess strong financial analysis skills.<p><br></p><ul><li>Undergraduate coursework in real estate finance, real estate valuation, or related fields</li><li>Knowledge of real estate valuation theory, methodologies, and applications</li><li>Strong analytical abilities</li><li>Proficiency with Excel (particularly modeling skills, writing macros, etc.) and PowerPoint</li><li>Experience in ARGUS is strongly preferred</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Strong work ethic and attention to detail</li><li>Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment</li><li>Excellent organizational, problem solving and communication skills</li><li>Possession of or progress towards real estate industry certification licenses, such as MAI, CCIM, certified general real estate appraiser</li><li>CPA, CFA or other financial credential a plus</li><li>Willingness to travel</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description - Associate</u></strong><p><br></p>Our Real Estate Valuation and Advisory Services (REVS) team is recruiting for a new Associate. We have availability in our Los Angeles, Chicago, Dallas and Atlanta offices. As an Associate, you will conduct financial research, review and analyze complex real estate models, help lead client diligence calls, and work with other Analysts, Associates and Officers to execute valuation advisory work, often in connection with high-profile real estate transactions. You will work with many leading REITs, real estate private equity firms, and real estate operators, analyzing and valuing their investments for a variety of purposes.<p><br></p>The Associate will work with a highly talented and dedicated staff of professionals who will give broad exposure to the many different issues and concerns affecting real estate businesses and investors today. The environment at Houlihan Lokey is collegial and entrepreneurial and rewards Associates with substantial responsibility and interaction with senior-level professionals.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities &amp; Deliverables</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Work alongside Analysts, Associates, and Officers valuing commercial real estate investments across various asset classes (multifamily, retail, industrial, hospitality, and more).</li><li>Be actively involved in various client engagements, including valuation and advisory work related to investor and financial reporting, due diligence, and transaction opinions.</li><li>Collect, manipulate, and analyze property, market and financial data.</li><li>Acquire knowledge of the use and capabilities of subscription data sources and software, including Costar, REIS, Green Street, Real Capital Analytics, Marshall Valuation Services, ARGUS, etc.</li><li>Analyze historic property operating statements and analyze leases.</li><li>Assist Officers in the preparation of complex cash flow models using Excel and/or ARGUS software, including analyzing available data to estimate revenues, costs, and rates of return.</li><li>Estimate value of real estate investments at various levels of the capital stack, including asset-level valuations, equity valuations, preferred equity valuations, and debt valuations.</li><li>Prepare reports and presentations to team and clients, including graphic and written sections.</li><li>Review Analysts and Associates work products, providing real-time coaching on technical and real estate market matters.</li><li>Regularly present results from modeling and valuation projects directly to Officers and Clients.</li><li>Assist in marketing pitches, real estate thought leadership articles, and other ad-hoc duties.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Basic Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>3-5 years of direct real estate valuation experience demonstrating analytical capabilities.</li><li>A strong interest in real estate advisory work (ie, valuation consulting).</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p>Teamwork is essential to the firm’s success. At the same time, creativity and new ideas are encouraged. Associates are given substantial responsibility and are encouraged to help us grow our business. The ideal candidate should be motivated, creative, outgoing, and possess strong financial analysis skills.<p><br></p><ul><li>Undergraduate coursework in real estate finance, real estate valuation, or related fields</li><li>Strong understanding of real estate valuation theory, methodologies, and applications</li><li>Exceptional analytical abilities</li><li>Strong Excel modeling skills (e.g., waterfall calculations, building discounted cash flows, writing macros, etc.) and PowerPoint</li><li>Proficiency in ARGUS</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Strong work ethic and attention to detail</li><li>Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment</li><li>Excellent organizational, problem solving and communication skills</li><li>Possession of or progress towards real estate industry certification licenses, such as MAI, CCIM, certified general real estate appraiser</li><li>CPA, CFA or other financial credential a plus</li><li>Active participation in real estate industry organizations (e.g., Appraisal Institute, ULI, NCREIF, NAREIT) a plus</li><li>Willingness to travel</li></ul><p><br></p>We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.<p><br></p><strong><u>The Firm’s Good Faith And Reasonable Estimate Of The Possible Salary Range For This Role At The Time Of Posting Is</u></strong><p><br></p>Houlihan Lokey is committed to providing its employees with an exciting career opportunity and competitive total compensation package.<p><br></p>$85,000-$140,000<p><br></p>Actual salary at the time of hire may vary and may be above or below the range based on various factors, including, but not limited to, the candidate’s relevant qualifications, skills, and experience and the location where this position may be filled.<p><br></p><em><strong>We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.</strong></em>

title: Analyst/Associate - Real Estate Valuation and Advisory Services (REVS)
description: <p><span>Client- Banco Popular</span></p><p><span>Job Title- .NET Application Developer</span></p><p><span>Location- Rosemont IL</span></p><p><span>Primary Skills- ASP.Net, C#, MVC, WCF, Silverlight, WWF, WPF, HTML, AJAX, Java/Java Script, Crystal Reports, XML, Web Services</span></p><p><span>Secondary Skills- Microsoft Azure, Microsoft Biz-Talk and SharePoint technologies</span></p><p><span>Contract Duration- 12 Months</span></p><p><span>Pay Rate: w2</span></p><p><span>&nbsp;</span></p><p><span>Job Description-</span></p><p><span>GENERAL DESCRIPTION:</span></p><p><span>This position is responsible for participating in all phases of the development life-cycle of new and existing business applications and production systems support for Client/Server and Web based applications (N-Tier). Primary focus is on programming, testing, and application support.</span></p><p><br></p><p><span>Technical Skills Basic Computer Skills -</span></p><p><span>• Strong Fluency user of Windows applications and Microsoft Office programs such as MS Project, Word, Excel and PowerPoint.</span></p><p><span>• Quickly learns and achieves proficiency in new software applications as needed.</span></p><p><span>• Demonstrates ability to create complex formulas in MS Excel; create queries in company software applications.</span></p><p><br></p><p><span>Application / Database Development -</span></p><p><span>• Follows IT development processes such as change management, configuration management, security compliance.</span></p><p><span>• Understands and applies company programming procedures to all work performed.</span></p><p><span>• Demonstrates and applies knowledge of application design principles, practices, systems development &amp; analysis.</span></p><p><span>• Demonstrate competency in debug/test and deploy/configure implementation programming.</span></p><p><span>• Demonstrates and applies knowledge of computer flow charts and programming logic and codes.</span></p><p><span>• Applies principles of good code development (e.g., reusability, maintainability and self-testing).</span></p><p><span>• Studies and understands the architecture and design parts of new or existing systems.</span></p><p><span>• Effectively learns and customizes packaged software.</span></p><p><span>• Proficiently processes computer data, performs maintenance and operational activities such as formatting and generating reports.</span></p><p><span>• Successfully implements and troubleshoots programming changes and modifications.</span></p><p><span>• 3+ years experience in Design, Develop, Test and Implement enterprise class applications.</span></p><p><span>• 1+ year's business requirements gathering/analysis experience.</span></p><p><span>• 1+ years experience in interpreting business requirements into technical specifications.</span></p><p><span>• 1+ years experience in system integration using real-time and batch techniques.</span></p><p><span>• 2+ years experience in object oriented analysis and design, design patterns, refactoring &amp; unit testing.</span></p><p><span>• 1+ years experience in Web services, Web service protocols and Service Oriented Architecture (SOA).</span></p><p><span>• 1+ years experience with UML diagrams and design tools such as Rational Rose or Visio.</span></p><p><span>• 2+ years experience with software development methodologies such as Waterfall, RUP, Agile methodologies such as SCRUM</span></p><p><span>• 1+years experience in Microsoft Azure, Microsoft Biz-Talk and SharePoint technologies</span></p><p><span>• 3+ years hands-on programming experience in ASP.Net, C#, MVC, WCF, Silverlight, WWF, WPF</span></p><p><span>• 2+ years Experience with SQL Server database programming &amp; reporting tools (Crystal Reports, Business Objects)</span></p><p><span>• 3+ years experience in HTML, AJAX, Java/Java Script, Crystal Reports, XML, Web Services.</span></p><p><span>• 2+ years experience developing rich web user interfaces and/or complex UI using custom or 3rd party UI controls.</span></p><p><br></p><p><span>Other IT Specific Skills -</span></p><p><span>• Quickly learns and begins supporting new systems and applications. Knowledge of maintenance, reparation and troubleshooting of desktop hardware and software packages for end-users via telephone and in-person.</span></p><p><span></span></p><p><br></p>

title: .NET Application Developer (w2)
description: <strong><u>Department</u></strong><p><br></p>BSD MED - Pulmonary - Parker Research Staff<p><br></p><strong><u>About The Department</u></strong><p><br></p>Dr. William Parker’s Healthcare Ethics and Allocation Laboratory (HEAL) in the Section of Pulmonary &amp; Critical Care Medicine.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>The Data Scientist will work in collaboration with Dr. Parker, a medical ethicist and health services researcher who studies the allocation of scarce medical resources. He is specifically interested in absolute scarcity problems, where demand greatly exceeds supply, and healthcare systems cannot avoid triage scenarios. He applies advanced empirical methods to evaluate and design allocation systems according to the underlying ethical principles. His current projects focus on deceased donor organ allocation, critical care/ventilator rationing under crisis standards of care, and COVID-19 vaccine allocation.<p><br></p>The position will focus on the development and execution of complex data analyses and modeling projects. Databases include electronic health record datasets and national transplant registries.<p><br></p>In collaboration with Dr. Parker, they will participate as a skilled individual contributor and/or lead researcher, contributing his/her high-level expertise to each project’s development.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Data cleaning and management.</li><li>Prepares analytic datasets using data analysis software (E.g. R tidyverse packages, Pandas for Python).</li><li>Follows the standards of transparent and reproducible data science including use version control software such as git and code with a literate programming style.</li><li>Anticipates data management needs, including identifying when data pulls will be necessary and obtaining newer versions of source national datasets.</li><li>Data visualization with appropriate statistical software, such as the ggplot2 package in R.</li><li>Fits complex statistical models with appropriate statistical software, such as R or Stata.</li><li>Trains, tunes, and tests machine learning prediction models with appropriate statistical software, such as scikit-learn, tensor flow, or pytorch packages.</li><li>Investigates and apply new data science methodologies to projects.</li><li>Reports results of data analysis, prepare figures and tables.</li><li>Draft and revise manuscripts for submission.</li><li>Prepares grant proposals.</li><li>Supervise medical students and other junior trainees.</li><li>Present research findings at meetings.</li><li>Analyzes moderately complex data sets for the purpose of extracting and purposefully using applicable information.</li><li>Provides professional support to staff or faculty members in defining the project and applying principals of data science in manipulation, statistical applications, programming, analysis and modeling.</li><li>Performs other related work as needed.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Education</u></strong><p><br></p><u><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong></u><p><br></p>Minimum requirements include a college or university degree in related field.<p><br></p><li></li><p><br></p><strong><u>Work Experience</u></strong><p><br></p>Minimum requirements include knowledge and skills developed through 2-5 years of work experience in a related job discipline.<p><br></p><li></li><p><br></p><strong><u>Certifications</u></strong><p><br></p><u><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong></u><p><br></p><strong><u>Education</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Advanced degree in statistics/epidemiology/computer science or related field.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Experience</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with electronic health record data.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Technical Skills Or Knowledge</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with conducting data analysis with analytic software (Stata, R, Python, etc.), query design, and presentation of data.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Competencies</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Knowledge of regulatory policies and procedures.</li><li>Analytical skills.</li><li>Problem-solving skills.</li><li>Attention to detail.</li><li>Organizational skills.</li><li>Verbal and written communication skills.</li><li>Work independently and as part of a team.</li></ul><p><br></p><u><strong>Application Documents</strong></u><p><br></p><ul><li>Resume (required)</li><li>Cover Letter (required)</li></ul><p><br></p>When applying, the document(s) <strong><u>MUST</u></strong> be uploaded via the <strong><u>My Experience</u></strong> page, in the section titled <strong><u>Application Documents</u></strong> of the application.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Family</u></strong><p><br></p>Research<p><br></p><u><strong>Role Impact</strong></u><p><br></p>Individual Contributor<p><br></p><strong><u>FLSA Status</u></strong><p><br></p>Exempt<p><br></p><strong><u>Pay Frequency</u></strong><p><br></p>Monthly<p><br></p><strong><u>Scheduled</u></strong><strong><u> Weekly Hours</u></strong><p><br></p>40<p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits Eligible</u></strong><p><br></p>Yes<p><br></p><strong><u>Drug Test Required</u></strong><p><br></p>No<p><br></p><strong><u>Health Screen Required</u></strong><p><br></p>No<p><br></p><strong><u>Motor Vehicle Record Inquiry Required</u></strong><p><br></p>No<p><br></p><strong><u>Posting Statement</u></strong><p><br></p>Employees must comply with the University’s COVID-19 vaccination requirements. More information about the requirements can be found on the University of Chicago Vaccination GoForward.<p><br></p>The University of Chicago is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity/Disabled/Veterans Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national or ethnic origin, age, status as an individual with a disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or other protected classes under the law. For additional information please see the University's Notice of Nondiscrimination.<p><br></p>Staff Job seekers in need of a reasonable accommodation to complete the application process should call 773-702-5800 or submit a request via Applicant Inquiry Form.<p><br></p>We seek a diverse pool of applicants who wish to join an academic community that places the highest value on rigorous inquiry and encourages a diversity of perspectives, experiences, groups of individuals, and ideas to inform and stimulate intellectual challenge, engagement, and exchange.<p><br></p>All offers of employment are contingent upon a background check that includes a review of conviction history. A conviction does not automatically preclude University employment. Rather, the University considers conviction information on a case-by-case basis and assesses the nature of the offense, the circumstances surrounding it, the proximity in time of the conviction, and its relevance to the position.<p><br></p>The University of Chicago's Annual Security &amp; Fire Safety Report (Report) provides information about University offices and programs that provide safety support, crime and fire statistics, emergency response and communications plans, and other policies and information. The Report can be accessed online at: http://securityreport.uchicago.edu. Paper copies of the Report are available, upon request, from the University of Chicago Police Department, 850 E. 61st Street, Chicago, IL 60637.

title: Data Scientist
description: <strong><u>Overview<br><br></u></strong><strong> Old National Bank is honored to be named one of the World's Most Ethical Companies for the 12th consecutive year! <br><br></strong>Old National Bank was established in 1834. Today, we are the largest financial services holding company with dual headquarters in Chicago and Evansville, IN. We provide an array of services to our clients which include Community Banking, Investments, and Wealth Management. At Old National, we believe that by helping our team members balance work life with home life, we create a more productive workforce and a stronger company.<br><br>We are currently seeking a Data Engineer responsible for the development and implementation of technical solutions. This role leverages technical expertise in database applications, ETL processes, and automation in support of internal and external customers data exchange and integration needs. Participate and deliver Salesforce integration and data warehouse project and later work as the main ETL support member after the go-live. We are not currently sponsoring H-1. Office is in Chicago near Rosemont Illinois.<br><br><strong>REQUIRED EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS:</strong>.<br><ul><li> Over 5 years of experience with Informatica developing ETL and recent experience with IICS. We prefer 3 years of experience with SSIS, and some knowledge of Python. </li><li> Expertise in designing and implementing Relational Database mode as per business needs </li><li> Must have experience in Database Development, Design, Analysis, SQL Servers 2015-2019 in Development, Testing and Production Environments with various business domains </li><li> Experienced in extracting, transforming and loading ETL data from excel, flat file. C and C# used for scripting in Script Tasking in SSIS to control the flow of SSIS package </li><li> Very good working experience of T-SQL. Proficiency in complex stored procedures, User Defined Functions (UDF), Database Triggers, using tools like SQL Profiler and Database Tuning Advisor (DTA) </li><li> Implemented incremental load for many SSIS packages. Experience in error handling, debugging, error logging for production support in SSIS. Experience in bulk importing CSV, XML and Flat files data using Bulk copy program (BCP) </li><li> Hands on experience in performance tuning and query optimization including updating statistics, rebuilding and re-organizing indexes </li><li> Experienced in normalizing and de-normalizing the tables and maintaining referential integrity by using triggers and primary and foreign keys </li><li> Ability to work independently and be able to collaborate and guide other team members </li><li> Strong written and oral communication, experience on reproving and presenting new design and solutions to senior leadership </li><li> Working knowledge of MS SSMS 2012 to 2019 </li><li> Working knowledge of analytical and data visualization technology such as Power BI, R Services </li><li> Working knowledge of cloud based data architectures leveraging PAAS, IAAS, DAAS etc.. </li><li> Familiarity with MS DQM, MDM, Big Data concepts Works well independently; capable of self-motivating and managing </li><li> Position may require the need to travel to other branch or meeting locations. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Duties/Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Design, development, and maintenance (enhancements and maintenance) of ETL processes and business intelligence solutions using the IICS and SQL Server Relational Database technologies. </li><li> Design and development of processes for various types of data (potentially large datasets and disparate data sources that require transformation and cleansing to become a usable data set.) </li><li> Monitor production jobs, maintain, and enhance legacy ETL processes on a regular basis. Improve slow running jobs with the help of redesign and better ETL processes to meet business needs. </li><li> Take directions, follow recommendations provided by data architecture, Info Security and data governance organization. </li><li> Confer with relevant team members where necessary. Study systems flow, data usage, and work processes. </li><li> Deliver functional work product that has been thoroughly tested. </li><li> Follow development team’s SDLC process. Accurately estimate time required to complete projects and tasks. </li><li> Meet mutually agreed upon deadlines for completion of modules throughout the program development. </li><li> Work very closely with the existing DBA to design, model, develop, and maintain existing and new SQL databases objects required for all business solutions <br></li></ul><strong><u>Key Competencies for Position <br></u></strong><ul><li> Works well independently; capable of self-motivating and managing. </li><li> Ability to work independently and be able to collaborate and guide other team members. </li><li> Strong written and oral communication, experience on reproving and presenting new design and solutions to senior leadership. <br></li></ul><strong> Old National is proud to be an equal opportunity employer focused on fostering an inclusive workplace and committed to hiring a workforce comprised of diverse backgrounds, cultures and thinking styles. <br><br></strong>As such, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.<br><br>We do not accept resumes from external staffing agencies or independent recruiters for any of our openings unless we have an agreement signed by the Head of Talent Acquisition, SVP, to fill a specific position.

title: Informatica IICS Data Engineer
description: Position TitlePosition NumberLocation<p><br></p>Position Title:<p><br></p>API Developer<p><br></p>Position Number:<p><br></p>442289<p><br></p>Location:<p><br></p>USA, IL, Chicago 60661 Position TypeSkills/Attributes<p><br></p>Position Type<p><br></p>Temporary<p><br></p>Skills/Attributes<p><br></p>API, Developer, Proxy Estimated Duration (In Weeks)<p><br></p>Estimated Duration (In Weeks)<p><br></p>52<p><br></p>Apply Now<p><br></p><strong>Description</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>**Only those lawfully authorized to work in the designated country associated with the position will be considered.**</li><li>**Please note that all Position start dates and duration are estimates and may be reduced or lengthened based upon a client’s business needs and requirements.**</li></ul><p><br></p>Job Title: API Developer<p><br></p>Client Job ID: 11484<p><br></p>Duration: 12 months<p><br></p>Location: Chicago IL 60661<p><br></p>Position’s Contributions to Work Group:<p><br></p><ul><li> AKA API Developer. This position is on the API Management team within Client Digital. The team is responsible for the process, controls, and tools that support API development, security, publishing, consumption, and monitoring. 1. Competent to perform all programming, project management, and development assignments without close supervision; normally assigned the more complex aspects of systems work. 2. Works directly on complex application/technical problem identification and resolution, including responding to off-shift and weekend support calls. 3. Works independently on complex systems or infrastructure components that may be used by one or more applications or systems. 4. Drives application development focused around delivering business valuable features 5. Maintains high standards of software quality within the team by establishing good practices and habits 6. Identifies and encourage areas for growth and improvement within the team 7. Guide the team to develop a structured application/interface code, new program documentation, operations documentation, and user guides in a casual, flexible environment. Communicate with end-users and internal customers to help direct the development, debugging, and testing of application software for accuracy, integrity, interoperability, and completeness. 8. Performs integrated testing and customer acceptance testing of components that requires careful planning and execution to ensure timely, quality results.</li></ul><p><br></p>Typical task breakdown:<p><br></p><ul><li> Work within API Management team, hands-on APIGEE Edge , OAS Spec review, Proxy development . Hybrid work , need to be at located at commutable distance from a Client Hub ( Chicago, Peoria and Dallas, TX)</li><li> Reviewing OAS /Swaggers - Operational</li><li> Developing Proxies - Operations</li></ul><p><br></p>- Developing Automations -<p><br></p><ul><li> Rotational weekly On Call Support /Incident Management using Service Now.</li></ul><p><br></p>Interaction with team:<p><br></p><ul><li> Will be working with team members across the world virtually. Will also be interacting with team members in the Chicago office twice a week.</li></ul><p><br></p>Education &amp; Experience Required:<p><br></p><ul><li> Position requires a four-year degree from an accredited college or university; 2-4 years’ experience in software development</li><li> Masters Degree: 2 years or more of software development experience</li></ul><p><br></p>Technical Skills<p><br></p>(Required)<p><br></p><ul><li> 1. Experience writing API proxies on platforms such as Apigee Edge, AWS API Gateway or Azure API Gateway or similar.</li><li> 2. Hands on experience with API tools such as Swagger Editor &amp; Postman, and linting tools like Spectral.</li><li> 3. Knowledge of security standards such as OAuth 2.0 and TLS.</li></ul><p><br></p>(Desired)<p><br></p><ul><li> *Familiarity working in a Scrum environment *Must demonstrate solid knowledge of computer science fundamentals like data structures and algorithms. *Hands on experience with metrics and visualization tools like Kibana, Grafana, or equivalent.</li></ul><p><br></p>Soft Skills<p><br></p>(Required)<p><br></p><ul><li> 1. Excellent written and verbal skills Ability to work under pressure and within time constraints. Passion for technology and an eagerness to contribute to a team-oriented environment.</li><li> Must be reliable and proactive – able to work independently and meet deadlines.</li><li> No tardiness</li></ul><p><br></p>Disqualifiers/Red Flags:<p><br></p><ul><li> Candidates who are known for lateness/tardiness</li><li> Candidates who have a history of being unreliable and not proactive.</li><li> Candidate who is looking for hardcore development, not a fit for this team; the role is primarily operations support.</li></ul><p><br></p>Interview Process: 2 rounds<p><br></p><ul><li> 1st technical discussion via teams</li><li> 2nd interview</li><li> At least one of the interviews will need to be in person ideally.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits:<br><br>For information and details on employment benefits offered with this position, please visit here. Should you have any questions/concerns, please contact our HR Department via our secure website. <br><br></strong><strong>California Pay Equity:<br><br>For information and details on pay equity laws in California, please visit the State of California Department of Industrial Relations' website here. <br><br></strong><strong>Rose International is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender (expression or identity), national origin, arrest and conviction records, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. Positions located in San Francisco and Los Angeles, California will be administered in accordance with their respective Fair Chance Ordinances. <br><br></strong><strong>If you need assistance in completing this application, or during any phase of the application, interview, hiring, or employment process, whether due to a disability or otherwise, please contact our HR Department. <br><br></strong><strong>Rose International has an official agreement (ID #132522), effective June 30, 2008, with the U.S. Department of Homeland Security, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services, Employment Verification Program (E-Verify). (Posting required by OCGA 13/10-91.).</strong>

title: API Developer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>Responsible for working closely with management to execute analytical initiatives. Responsible for solving business problems by leveraging techniques such as segmentation, optimization, advanced analytics and machine learning. Creates reports and dashboards to closely monitor performance metrics and provide insights.Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p>What You'll Do<p><br></p><ul><li>Work closely with management to execute analytical initiatives.</li><li>Solve business problems by leveraging techniques such as segmentation, optimization, advanced analytics and machine learning.</li><li>Create reports and dashboards to closely monitor performance metrics and provide insights.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>How You'll Do It</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develop advanced analytics solutions including customer segmentation, optimization, test &amp; design of experiments and prescriptive analytics to solve business problems. Operate as a subject matter expert on statistical analysis, test and design of experiment, analysis methodology, modeling &amp; application and financial impact analysis.</li><li>Collaborate with cross-functional partners to understand their business needs, formulated and completed end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering, analysis, ongoing scaled deliverables and presentations. Deliver effective presentations of findings and recommendations to multiple levels of leadership, creating visual displays of quantitative information.</li><li>Establish and maintain effective performance tracking; identify improvement opportunity, form hypothesis, propose, design and implement tests to drive strategy enhancement and optimization.</li><li>Manage multiple priorities, communicate business performance and project progress to management &amp; business partners.</li><li>Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for analytical needs. Facilitate implementation of work product and ensure accuracy.</li><li>Consistently follow standard work processes and documentation requirements. Recommend improvement to work processes to increase efficiency while maintaining quality of work. Continuously improve technical and leadership skills through training and development.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications You'll Need</strong><p><br></p><strong>The Basics</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree in Analytics, Engineering, Statistics or related field</li><li>2+ years of experience in Credit Risk, Fraud Risk, Marketing Analytics, Optimization, Operations Analytics, Modeling/Data Science or related field</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Master’s Degree in Analytics, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or related field</li><li>Experience in Credit Risk, Fraud Risk, Marketing Analytics, Optimization, Operations Analytics, Modeling/Data Science or related field</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $83,500.00 to $116,700.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: Application Engineer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>What You'll Do<p><br></p><ul><li>Work closely with management to execute analytical initiatives.</li><li>Solve business problems by leveraging techniques such as segmentation, optimization, advanced analytics and machine learning.</li><li>Create reports and dashboards to closely monitor performance metrics and provide insights.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>How You'll Do It</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develop advanced analytics solutions including customer segmentation, optimization, test &amp; design of experiments and prescriptive analytics to solve business problems. Operate as a subject matter expert on statistical analysis, test and design of experiment, analysis methodology, modeling &amp; application and financial impact analysis.</li><li>Collaborate with cross-functional partners to understand their business needs, formulated and completed end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering, analysis, ongoing scaled deliverables and presentations. Deliver effective presentations of findings and recommendations to multiple levels of leadership, creating visual displays of quantitative information.</li><li>Establish and maintain effective performance tracking; identify improvement opportunity, form hypothesis, propose, design and implement tests to drive strategy enhancement and optimization.</li><li>Manage multiple priorities, communicate business performance and project progress to management &amp; business partners.</li><li>Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for analytical needs. Facilitate implementation of work product and ensure accuracy.</li><li>Consistently follow standard work processes and documentation requirements. Recommend improvement to work processes to increase efficiency while maintaining quality of work. Continuously improve technical and leadership skills through training and development.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Basic Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree in Analytics, Engineering, Statistics or related field</li><li>2+ years of experience in Credit Risk, Fraud Risk, Marketing Analytics, Optimization, Operations Analytics, Modeling/Data Science or related field</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Master’s Degree in Analytics, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or related field</li><li>Experience in Credit Risk, Fraud Risk, Marketing Analytics, Optimization, Operations Analytics, Modeling/Data Science or related field</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $83,500.00 to $116,700.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: Senior Data Science
description: We are PEAK6, a leading investment firm. You'll find us headquartered in the historic Chicago Board of Trade building, where we first opened our doors in 1997. It's been over 20 years since we were one of the first firms to develop sophisticated proprietary technology to use in our trading business. Today, we continue to leverage our technical ingenuity and operational excellence across several investment areas, spanning early-to-mid stage growth capital, operational control, trading, and e-sports, while always proving value to the customer. Throughout the years, we've built and operated several financial technology firms, and we continue to evolve. You'll find a bit of everything here, and we're always looking to take on new endeavors.<br><br>Technology Experience builds state-of-the-art people-centric solutions that transform and accelerate the PEAK6 Family of Brands. We operate important technology systems efficiently and securely while providing reliable products, services and data-driven analytics. We deliver a unified technology experience throughout the PEAK6 Family of Brands tailored where necessary to fit each business.<br><br>As an IT<strong> Integration Engineer</strong> in Technology Experience, you will be instrumental in the experience of all our employees throughout the PEAK6 Family of Brands. We’re looking for someone who takes ownership of their work, is resourceful in their problem-solving skills and is able to think creatively. You will be responsible for day-to-day maintenance, administration, and support of multiple SaaS solutions within Technology Experience. You will take on projects that will require clear communication and completion in a timely manner. We want someone who has a passion for setting the performance bar and thrives in an energetic team environment, while delivering a fully integrated solution that fits into one unified technology stack.<br><br>PEAK6 Technology Experience places emphasis on delivering white-glove customer service. Therefore, it is imperative for the IT Integration Engineer to place value on detail; but also, pair this with a sense of urgency for execution. Technology Experience is looking for people who have compassion and empathy for their teammates and a natural IT intuition who can work harder, faster and smarter while taking technical excellence to a whole new level.<br><br>You’ll be responsible for <strong>:<br></strong><ul><li>Manage and implement great experiences using our SaaS and cloud platform.</li><li>Primary contact person for troubleshooting cloud offerings.</li><li>Assist with implementation of integrations between critical technology solutions into our SaaS offering.</li><li>In collaboration with team members and leadership, implement great support processes, procedures, and documentation.</li><li>Identify opportunities for business enablement through smart use of technology.</li><li>Manage SaaS integrations through industry-standard best practices.</li><li>Manage, support, and provision business applications in a cloud-based environment.</li><li>Write clear, concise documentation for team members in wiki tools (Confluence).</li><li>Evaluate and recommend new software platforms and services.<br><br></li></ul>You’ll gain loads of experience in this role but before you do, you should have <strong>:<br></strong><ul><li>3+ years of experience supporting integrations of SaaS products.</li><li>Experience utilizing APIs to integrate custom solutions from SaaS offerings.</li><li>Experience with Cloud compute platforms such as AWS, GCP, and Azure.</li><li>Experience with administrating Office365, including comprehensive knowledge of all applications and services within, including OneDrive and SharePoint.</li><li>Experience with managing IDM solutions.</li><li>Experience with Atlassian tools such as Confluence and Jira.</li><li>Experience with Video Conferencing solutions such as Zoom.</li><li>Excellent interpersonal communication skills.</li><li>Experience administering ticketing platforms.<br><br></li></ul>

title: IT Integration Engineer
description: *We are unable to sponsor for this permanent Full time role*<p><br></p>*Position is bonus eligible*<p><br></p>Prestigious Global Firm is currently seeking a Kafka Cloud Engineer. Candidate will perform a range of activities required to both maintain and continuously automate a large, complex virtualization and cloud-based computing environment. In addition, you will provide technical guidance within the team on kafka and when called upon, serve as a technical liaison between internal departments. This will involve utilizing best practices for the management, architecture, configuration, DR, administration, and automation of the enterprise server virtualization environment with cloud technologies.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Provide professional input to the organization for cloud and virtualization end-to-end architecture and IaaS, as well as PaaS and SaaS solutions such as AWS RedShift</li><li>Develop and maintain a library of deployable, tested, and documented automation design scripts, processes, and procedures</li><li>Enable DevOps development activities and complex development tasks that will involve working with tools such as Docker, Kafka and container management systems</li><li>Provide advanced Kafka administrative support</li><li>Design, configure, implement and support an automated workflow for cloud and virtual environment provisioning, with a particular focus on Kafka clusters.</li><li>Implement production changes during defined maintenance windows and support on call rotation</li><li>Perform cloud computing and virtual environment build-outs, software installation, maintenance and support</li><li>Write and maintain documentation of relevant operating procedures and processes</li><li>Design, develop, and build the business's cloud infrastructure architecture</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Strong experience with Confluent's Kafka Products and Platforms</li><li>[Working knowledge of infrastructure design and components, such as: Servers, operating systems, networks, and storage (basic) and (advanced) knowledge of Confluent Kafka.</li><li>Experience with architecting, implementing and maintaining highly available mission critical environments for 24/7 availability</li><li>Experience working in an environment with a defined production change control process</li><li>[Demonstrates history of working within deadlines and ability to work well under pressure</li><li>Strong hands-on experience Scripting/development skills in Python, Ruby, Go, Java, JavaScript, etc. in a corporate environment </li><li>Hands-on experience with: Terraform, Kubernetes, Jenkins, Kafka, Github, OpenShift, and configuration management tools such as Ansible.</li><li>Relevant experience with configuration and implementation of IaaS, Infrastructure as code, AWS.</li><li>AWS Solutions Architect Associate Certification or higher strongly desired</li><li>Relevant industry certifications such as Confluent Certified Administrator for Apache Kafka</li><li>Certificates or Licenses:</li><li>Bachelor's degree, preferably in a technical discipline (Computer Science, Mathematics, etc.), or equivalent combination of education and experience required</li><li>3+ years experience in IT systems installation, operations, administration, and maintenance of virtualized Servers/cloud systems and Kafka systems.</li></ul>

title: Kafka Cloud Engineer
description: The Software Engineer will initially focus on partnering with internal and external stakeholders to lead and manage the implementation of CDW’s new HCM system, Workday. This role will be responsible for helping design and deploy a best practice global HCM system that supports CDW’s HR strategy. The Software Engineer will be responsible for development within the application, implementation support. This role will be responsible for the overall health of the platform and the long term vision. This role will be guided by CDW’s Enterprise Architecture function and will continue to improve CDW overall application technology. This role will be critical to create alignment across the multiple functions within HR and ensure there is consensus on how the different modules within Workday (e.g. recruiting, compensation, talent management, etc.) are interconnected.<p><br></p>This role requires someone with strong analytical skills and the ability to breakdown complex problems and strong communication skills.<p><br></p>Key Areas of Responsibility<p><br></p><ul><li>Collaborate with business teams to clarify requirements and business needs. </li><li>Develop system applications to CDW coding standards and quality. </li><li>Technically manage complex and large-scale project efforts in development, maintenance and enhancements of business system applications. </li><li>Collaborate with other CDW teams to determine the optimal solution architecture to ensure application efficiency, maintainability, and scalability. </li><li>Collaborate with business teams to develop high-level system narratives, and storyboards. </li><li>Develop and update Disaster Recovery plans and participate in DR testing activities. </li><li>Complete projects/tasks on a timely basis, according to commitments made to stakeholders and management. </li><li>Proactively update stakeholders and maintain open and courteous communication. </li><li>Report project/task status to the appropriate Application Development Manager on a weekly basis. </li><li>Utilize an object-oriented software lifecycle methodology. </li><li>Serve as a mentor/technical resource for Application Admin team and Application Developers. <br><br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Education And/or Experience Qualifications </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5 years in application experience </li><li>Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience. <br><br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Required Qualifications </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Demonstrated ability to mentor and coach others.</li><li>Expertise in the appropriate technical language as aligned under required qualifications below.</li><li>Demonstrated ability to understand and articulate details and impacts of complex proposed software solutions.</li><li>Proven knowledge in all stages of the software development life cycle.</li><li>History of working independently with little direction.</li><li>Strong planning and organizational skills with critical attention to detail and creative problem-solving skills.</li><li>Track record of balancing multiple priorities simultaneously with the ability to adapt to the changing needs of the business while meeting deadlines.</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to effectively communicate with all stakeholders including senior leadership.</li><li>3+ years of workday HRIS experience and Global Payroll<br><br></li></ul><p><br></p>Preferred Qualifications<p><br></p><ul><li>Demonstrated resourcefulness in the software administration and development processes and creative problem-solving skills.</li><li>Experience with Workday Beneifts, Time Tracking, Security, Reporting and Integrations<br><br></li></ul><p><br></p>COVID-19 Update:<p><br></p>CDW is committed to maintaining a workplace that is free of known hazards and to ensuring the safety, health, and well-being of coworkers and candidates for employment and their families, as well as the community.<p><br></p>CDW requires all coworkers be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, with the only exceptions being a documented, legally required medical or religious accommodation. Prior to starting with CDW, successful candidates will be required to: (i) be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide CDW with proof of full vaccination; or (ii) apply for and receive a medical or religious-based accommodation to be exempt from the mandatory vaccination policy.

title: Workday Developer
description: At IHI Terrasun, we are at the forefront of changing the world with green energy solutions. To build on our incredible success, we need a driven, curious, and collaborative people to join our growing team.<br><br>We know our most important assets are our people, and your role will be critical to our future success.<br><br>Position Summary<br><br>We are currently seeking a DevOps Engineer to support our growing needs of managing AWS Cloud, continuous integration, testing and deployment processes, system administration and on-premises software delivery. You will be expected to take ownership of important systems and independently take them from planning to completion.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br><br></strong>Primary Job Functions<br><ul><li>Design, implement, maintain, monitor, and support scalable Cloud Infrastructure. </li><li>Automate the provisioning of the Cloud environments through the concept of pipeline engineering using Terraform, Ansible, Jenkins and other tools. </li><li>Partner with developers to design and execute the plan for CICD operation. </li><li>Support and improve our "on-premises" deployment option. </li><li>Work with Security team to take initiatives on security update on-site or in AWS Cloud operation. </li><li>Implement monitoring system using Prometheus and Grafana. </li><li>Plan and design Group Policy Objects as requested to ensure compliance of company policies for servers and user end-point devices. </li><li>Remain up to date on emerging technologies and architecture and propose ways to use them in current and upcoming projects. </li><li>Collaborate with Architecture team(s) to advise on any needed enabling work and make decisions regarding sequencing to ensure optimal delivery of value for business. </li><li>Support Authentication using 0365, LDAP integration etc. </li><li>Ability to perform Risk assessments for Cloud infrastructure. </li><li>Support AWS IAM and Security Manager. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Core Competencies<br></strong><ul><li>The ability to apply a software engineering mindset to system administration topics. </li><li>Minimum 5 years' experience as AWS DevOps Engineer. </li><li>Minimum 3 years of experience working in an Agile environment and have knowledge of both Scrum and Kanban. </li><li>Preferred 2-3 years working with CICD pipelines and experience with Ansible and terraform for software provisioning, configuration management and application deployment to enable IAC. </li><li>Minimum 2 years' experience in one or more experience in Python, Bash, AWS CLI/SDK. </li><li>Positive Can-do Attitude and High Degree of Initiative. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in relevant Engineering discipline from four-year college or university; or four to six years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. </li><li>Understanding of NERC-CIP, ISO 27001, ISO 27019, and / or NIST SP 800-53 would be a plus</li><li>Certifications: AWS Certification</li><li>Knowledgeable of the capabilities and limitations of AWS</li><li>Excellent communication (written, verbal and presentation) skills, and advanced problem-solving orientation and decision-making skills. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Work Environment &amp; Physical Demands<br></strong><ul><li>The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the primary job functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions. </li><li>Work is performed in an office environment. The employee is required to frequently sit and occasionally must stand, walk, use hands and fingers, and reach with hands and arms. Also, the employee must be able to read and analyze data in hard copy and on a computer screen. </li><li>Travel potentially less than 10%. <br><br></li></ul><strong>About IHI Terrasun Solutions: <br><br></strong>IHI Terrasun Solutions is a subsidiary of IHI Corporation, a 165-year-old, $15 Billion organization with deep energy industry experience. IHI Terrasun Solutions is a solar + storage systems integration and lifecycle services provider with highly integrated hardware and software capabilities.<br><br>The robust software and top tier energy storage solutions are developed by the expert team at IHI Terrasun Solutions. Employees have extensive industry knowledge and experience, and enthusiastically seek to build on IHI's advanced product offerings.<br><br>To design systems, IHI Terrasun Solutions uses proprietary software that operates on the same algorithm later used to deploy the system in real-time. This end-to-end algorithm structure coupled with the support offered by a well-established parent organization enables IHI Terrasun Solutions to provide an advanced warranty to customers, reducing project risk and increasing clarity on system scheduling and deployment.<br><br>With solar + storage expertise, robust service offerings, and technology-agnostic solutions, IHI Terrasun Solutions develops efficient and streamlined systems to achieve your energy storage goals.<br><br>IHI Terrasun has over 480MWh of projects currently installed, contracted, and in construction with over 1GWh of projects in advanced phase of contracting.<br><br><strong>Benefits:<br><br></strong>Not only do our employees get the chance to work in a rapidly growing energy business with global impact, they also have access to some of the best benefits in the industry, including:<br><ul><li>100% employer paid health, dental, and vision insurance for our premium Anthem Blue Cross PPO plan</li><li>401(k) plan contribution matching</li><li>Employer sponsored Life, AD&amp;D, Short-Term and Long-Term Disability Insurance</li><li>Tuition and continuing education stipend</li><li>Fantastic employee culture</li></ul>

title: DevOps Engineer
description: Your Opportunity<br><br>At Schwab, you’re empowered to make an impact on your career. Here, innovative thought meets creative problem solving, helping us “challenge the status quo” and transform the finance industry together.<br><br>Are you all about using data to provide customers better products and grow business? We are looking for qualified candidates to craft and implement scalable machine learning solutions for multifaceted financial products, deliver business insights from unstructured data with clear narratives and creative visualizations, and partner closely with the data infrastructure and platforms teams to develop tools and automation. We have a large and diverse set of data, sourced from our extensive client base and huge volume of transactions across multiple channels. This is a phenomenal opportunity to apply your craft as a data scientist while working with business partners to drive data-driven solutions.<br><br>Data, Analytics and Insights (DAI) is a hard-working, fun team of 140+ that supports multiple business units across Schwab with quantitative-based decision support. Our mission is to help our business partners better understand the needs and behaviors of our prospects and clients through analytics, data science, market research, and business intelligence.<br><br>What you are good at<br><br>You will work collaboratively with a team of product managers, data scientists, IA ops, and engineers, throughout the project lifecycle including data extraction and preparation, design and implementation of algorithms, and creating solutions that solve real world problems.<br><ul><li>Use NLP to build chatbot that will be used by Schwab clients and prospects across different channels and instrument Dialogflow for intents</li><li>Experiment with LLMs and apply understanding in the evolving field of Generative AI</li><li>Get hands-on with large disparate datasets, hack through complex and messy data, and analyze it using the latest algorithms and innovative techniques and tools.</li><li>Use open source tools and platforms like Anaconda Enterprise &amp; Python to apply algorithms and analytic models to big data problems.<br></li></ul>What you have<br><br><strong>NLP:</strong> Knowledge of NLP concepts including Generative AI, and hands on experience in building NLP models and experimenting with LLMs. Ability to make data driven decisions to train and re-train Dialogflow intents. Experience with extracting relevant data from user transcripts including cleaning, lemmatizing and building text corpus for developing models<br><br><strong>Statistical Methodology:</strong> Knowledge of sophisticated techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc). Ability to understand model performance<br><br><strong>Machine Learning:</strong> Knowledge of and experience with designing and implementing algorithms (clustering, decision tree learning, GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, social network analysis, etc), and the ability to articulate their real-world advantages and drawbacks.<br><br><strong>Business insight</strong>: You understand the bigger picture for customers and the business and know how to probe beyond partners’ stated requests to really understand their needs and the value of information.<br><ul><li>Graduate degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Engineering or similar quantitative field.</li><li>Hands on experience in working on platforms/environments such as Google Dialogflow, GCP, Tableau, SQL server, Hive</li><li>6+ years’ experience in delivering data science solutions/services</li><li>3+ years experience in Python, data engineering, analytics role</li><li>Proactive, critical thinker, bias to action and a go-getter demeanor<br></li></ul><strong>Even Better.<br></strong><ul><li>Enthusiastic quick learner who loves to code</li><li>Experience in financial services would be a plus but not necessarily a requirement.</li></ul>

title: Test & Validation Engineer
description: <ul><li>Looking for a new Electronics Testing position? *</li><li>I have the one for you!* My client is currently hiring for an experienced Test Engineer to develop manufacturing tests to be performed on every unit that they build to make sure it is free of manufacturing flaws. This client manufactures electronics and telematics offerings for the automotive/transportation industry, so we are in need of someone with a manufacturing test experience. This position will be using LabView, Test Stands, along with C# with the flexibility of interchanging these languages.</li><li>Responsibilities:*</li><li>Quote, Design, and Develop manufacturing test solutions for New Product Introduction</li><li>Develop software (C#, C, and NI TestStand) to control test instruments and Units Under Test in order to meet product test requirements</li><li>Demonstrate the ability to develop hardware and software for production test solutions</li><li>Experience interpreting MySQL database schema and writing database queries</li><li>Provide ongoing support for existing products related to ECOs, yield issues, reliability improvements, and other continuous improvement initiatives</li><li>Written and verbal communication skills to effectively communicate with customers, suppliers, and internal project stakeholders</li><li>Manage project scopes and timelines and coordinate initiatives with Project Managers</li><li>Collaborate with Production Engineers and Supervisors to integrate test systems into the production process</li><li>Analyze test performance data and use production personnel input to drive test improvements opportunities</li><li>Ability to develop and interpret test requirements and identify test equipment required to meet those requirements</li><li>Ability to identify, assess, and resolve hardware and software issues</li><li>Compile and interpret Gage R&amp;R and Cpk studies</li><li>Support Root Cause Analysis of field return issues and implement additional test coverage as needed</li><li>Create documentation describing test design concepts and operator instructions</li><li>Experience related to manufacturing Printed Circuit Board Assemblies</li><li>Participate in peer reviews of test solutions</li><li>Top Skills:*</li><li>Labview</li><li>C#</li><li>Test Stand</li><li>SQL</li><li>Manufacturing Test</li><li>Test Automation</li><li>Test development/design</li><li>Hardware</li><li>Experience developing test for RF or wireless devices</li><li>Employee Perks:*</li><li>Paid Weekly</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K plans</li><li>Abenity Discount Program</li><li>Udemy Courses</li><li>Work Life Balance</li><li>PTO</li><li>Paid Holiday's</li><li>Experience Level:* 5+ years experience<br><br></li></ul>About title: Devops Engineer
description: <p><strong>Role: .NET Developer</strong></p><p><strong>Location: Alpharetta, GA  / TX /  NY / IL (onsite)</strong></p><p><strong>Duration: Long term</strong></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p><span>&nbsp;</span><strong>OPT EAD,CPT EAD,H4 EAD,USC,GC EAD are fine </strong></p><p><strong>EXP :5+ years</strong></p><p><strong>Prefferd Local candidates only</strong></p><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>Note : Don’t share H1B profile</strong></p><p><span>&nbsp;</span></p><p>  <span>Description for Internal Candidates</span></p><p>   <span>What will you do?</span></p><ul><li>Develop a solution for building REST Based Microservices</li><li>Translate Business Requirements into appropriate Microservices and Integration model.</li><li>Build security models around the Microservices with appropriate access control, policies and authentication.</li><li>Develop high performing Microservices that scale to millions of requests.</li><li>Develop API solutions to offer simple, easy to consume APIs for Fintech companies.&nbsp;&nbsp;</li><li>Participate in development of roadmap and strategies for documenting and presenting API specifications in an easy and consumable format.&nbsp;</li><li>Communicate the design to various teams.</li></ul><p><span>What do we need?</span></p><ul><li>5 years or more experience building REST Based API using .NET Web API</li><li>At least 3 years of experience with the latest .NET Frameworks such as .NET Core or .NET 6.</li><li><strong>Experience in using the design patterns in the system and Solid principles</strong></li><li>Developing and deployment of various Azure Functions and App Services</li><li>At least recent 3 years of experience building applications using Azure Platform</li><li>Hands-On experience in building Microservices using Azure Cloud Services such as Azure SQL, Azure Storage, Azure Cosmos, Azure Redis, Azure Event Hub.</li><li>Experience in Azure Service Bus and Event Grids</li><li>Experience with NuGet dependency management for building microservices.</li><li>Hands on experience in developing xUnit or NUnit test cases with mocking frameworks such as Moq&nbsp;or AutoFac or NSubstitute, and experience is using Fluent validation</li><li>Understanding on deploying microservices in the Azure Environments.</li><li>Understanding on building high available applications using AKS</li><li>At least 2 years of experience with SSO integration with REST Based API with major IAM provider such as ForgeRock, Ping Identity or Okta</li><li>Understanding of Auth Token consumption such as OAUTH, SAML, or JWT Token</li><li>Experience is Azure DevOps, such as building the pipeline and releases.</li></ul><p><br></p>

title: RPG Developers with PRMS
description: Role: BPM IBM BAW Developers Location: Richfield, MN or Chicago, IL Profile Senior developer who is very technical that will work closely with on-shore lead. They will have their own offshore team as well. Need this person to answer questions for the offshore team if the leads aren't available. More than 50% of hands on technical development. Be able to follow up the next morning and check on work. They want no pause in work. The work has to be continuous with good communication and transition from on-shore to offshore team. The team is already assembled. There is jazz sessions every Thursday. This is an all hands on deck approach. Has had past experiences where people have said they would relocate and then never would. They can only sit in the office in Richfield. They want this person side by side with this person to help with communication and everyone is on the same page. They want this person to help with decision making. Looking for BPM Developer - Needs to have IBM BAW Tech IBM BAW (Business Automation Workflow) 21.0 (Required - deadline is too short to have someone to catch up) Must haves: 10+ years of experience modeling processes using IBM BPM Process Designer, Integration, Implementing UCAs, Ajax, Generic System Services. Strong hands on core Java/J2EE/XML development and with SOA (REST and/or SOAP) Strong hands on experience with Process Designer, BPDs and Coach Framework as a Front End technology. Strong hands on experience with with Process Modules, SCA modules and various bindings, Mediation modules, libraries, message handing, error handling, Human Tasks, BO, SDO, Business Rules Strong hands on experience with REST/SOAP to consume complex enterprise interface solutions. Strong hands on experience with applying governance model, managing releases/ change cycles. Strong hands on experience with CI/CD experience, knowledge of ALM tools Git, Jenkins, Ansible, UrbanCode and other deployment tools. Strong communication skills and the ability to interact with all levels of business users and technical resources. Strong hands on experience working with designers in creating wireframes &amp; mockups. Nice to haves: Knowledge on with DB[SQL Server/Oracle] Programming experience. Knowledge of Java/J2EE. Knowledge of Banking &amp; Financial Services domain. Agile Experience.

title: BPM IBM BAW Developers
description: Cognizant Technology Solutions is seeking for “AS400 developer”; who could join in our team of IT professionals in a permanent role. If you meet our background requirements and skills and looking for an opportunity to be rewarded for your skills and expertise, here is the ideal opportunity for you!<br><br>Job Location: This is a remote position open to any qualified applicant in the United States.<br><br><strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong>Work experience required minimum 5-10 years<br><br>The AS400 developer will be responsible for supporting day to day operations of an existing AS400 solution. Will be working alongside the creator and current support SME of the particular AS400 solution. Expected to collaborate closely with business partners and IT Owners. Further, it is desired that extensive learning occurs to assist in knowledge transfer of the AS400 for future transition of that knowledge to a future replacement.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>AS400 developer will be responsible for supporting day to day operations of an existing AS400 solution.<br><br>Expected to collaborate closely with business partners and IT Owners.<br><br>Perform Unit testing and System Integration Testing.<br><br><strong><u>Skills And Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>5-10 years of experience in AS/400, Synon, RPG<br><br>Excellent written and verbal communication<br><br>Ability to multi-task and context-switch effectively between different activities and teams<br><br><strong><u>Must Have<br><br></u></strong>Synon/2E development experience (aka Cool/2E) – minimum of 1 year<br><br>AS/400 Command Language (CL)<br><br>RPG skills are a plus for debugging code.<br><br>Strong QA/testing skills, writing test scenarios, test scripts, &amp; execution<br><br><strong><u>Nice To Have<br><br></u></strong>Retail or Healthcare domain<br><br>Employee Status : Full Time Employee<br><br>Shift : Day Job<br><br>Travel : No<br><br>Job Posting : May 15 2023<br><br><strong><u>About Cognizant<br><br></u></strong>Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 185 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @USJobsCognizant.<br><br>Applicants may be required to attend interviews in person or by video conference. In addition, candidates may be required to present their current state or government issued ID during each interview.<br><br>Cognizant is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.<br><br>If you have a disability that requires a reasonable accommodation to search for a job opening or submit an application, please email CareersNA2@cognizant.com with your request and contact information.
