Further, it is desired that extensive learning occurs to assist in knowledge transfer of the AS400 for future transition of that knowledge to a future replacement.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>AS400 developer will be responsible for supporting day to day operations of an existing AS400 solution.<br><br>Expected to collaborate closely with business partners and IT Owners.<br><br>Perform Unit testing and System Integration Testing.<br><br><strong><u>Skills And Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>5-10 years of experience in AS/400, Synon, RPG<br><br>Excellent written and verbal communication<br><br>Ability to multi-task and context-switch effectively between different activities and teams<br><br><strong><u>Must Have<br><br></u></strong>Synon/2E development experience (aka Cool/2E) – minimum of 1 year<br><br>AS/400 Command Language (CL)<br><br>RPG skills are a plus for debugging code.<br><br>Strong QA/testing skills, writing test scenarios, test scripts, &amp; execution<br><br><strong><u>Nice To Have<br><br></u></strong>Retail or Healthcare domain<br><br>Employee Status : Full Time Employee<br><br>Shift : Day Job<br><br>Travel : No<br><br>Job Posting : May 15 2023<br><br><strong><u>About Cognizant<br><br></u></strong>Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 185 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @USJobsCognizant.<br><br>Applicants may be required to attend interviews in person or by video conference. In addition, candidates may be required to present their current state or government issued ID during each interview.<br><br>Cognizant is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.<br><br>If you have a disability that requires a reasonable accommodation to search for a job opening or submit an application, please email CareersNA2@cognizant.com with your request and contact information.

title: Test Engineer
description: <ul><li>Looking for a new Firmware Engineering position? *</li><li>I have the one for you!* My client is currently hiring for a Firmware Engineer to design, develop, document and analyze new and modified professional medical scale designs. This position would involve designing and developing embedded applications. You would be in charge of selecting and evaluating microprocessors, platforms, operating systems and firmware architecture solutions that meet performance and product cost needs. In this role you would be working closely with other team engineers, product management, and marketing for product development from inception to completion. The last responsibility in this role would be to generate engineering documentation such as software flow charts, functional specifications and test plans.</li><li>Top Skills Details:*</li><li>Firmware</li><li>Microcontroller</li><li>Microprocessor</li><li>Software Troubleshooting</li><li>Hardware</li><li>C/C++</li><li>STM</li><li>TI Chip</li><li>New Product Development</li><li>Embedded Controllers</li><li>Hardware Design Software</li><li>General Validation Experiences</li><li>Software Flow Chart</li><li>Effective Troubleshooting skills and practice experience with system programming</li><li>Employee Perks:*</li><li>Paid Weekly</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K plans</li><li>Abenity Discount Program</li><li>Udemy Courses</li><li>Work Life Balance</li><li>PTO</li><li>Paid Holidays</li><li>Experience Level:* Bachelor’s degree in Electrical/Computer Engineering with 8+ years of experience<br><br></li></ul>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. title: IBM iSeries/AS400 Developer (remote)
description: <strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong>S&amp;C Electronics, a global leader for power reliability products is looking for a Software Project Engineer. Included in this position is the support of intelligent embedded software devices including microprocessor-based switch and fault interrupting controls. Candidates must have a strong background in design and development of embedded software on custom electronics.<br><br>This position can be remote (located in the United States) or on-site/hybrid at one of our office locations (Chicago, Alameda, or Franklin). Occasional travel to (10%) to one of these locations may be required for development, system integration/testing, and debugging. In this position, you will report to the Senior Manager – Embedded Firmware in Chicago.<br><br><strong>The work associated with this position includes, but is not limited to, the following:<br></strong><ul><li>Design embedded application firmware for microprocessor-based fault interrupting controls.</li><li>Contribute to the development of architecture design, software specifications, project schedules, task and project completion time estimates, and test plans.</li><li>Develop embedded C/C++ firmware for low power designs, including hardware device drivers.</li><li>Develop and support PC-based engineering test tools as needed.</li><li>Create, execute, and automate Unit Tests.</li><li>Review and implement product requirements.</li><li>Participate in Agile scrum meetings and peer reviews of source code.</li><li>Investigate new technologies and create design documents as necessary.</li><li>Collaborate with hardware and test engineers to support verification and validation of products at the module level and system level.</li><li>Work with product management and field services to resolve firmware-related customer issues. <br></li></ul><strong>To select this job as one of interest to you, at a minimum, you must have the following:<br></strong><ul><li>Being a team player is essential.</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communications skills.</li><li>Technical leadership abilities with good interpersonal skills.</li><li>Continuous learner and self-starter.</li><li>BS degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent.</li><li>Demonstrated working knowledge of programming principles in C/C++ and Python.</li><li>Familiarity with real-time operation and low power microprocessor modes.</li><li>Embedded software development experience with and without an operating system.</li><li>Experience with digital multimeters, oscilloscopes, and logic analyzers.</li><li>Experience working with and writing drivers for common peripherals and interconnects, such as GPIO, I2C, SPI, ADC, DAC, UART, DMA, flash memory.</li><li>Experience with configuration management/process tools: Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket/Git.</li><li>Experience in one or more of the following areas is preferred: electric grid automation and/or control for utility applications, peer-to-peer communications techniques, wired and wireless communications experience (Ethernet, Bluetooth, Wi-Fi). </li><li>Experience with signal processing (FFT, DFT, waveform analysis) and actuator/motor control is a plus.</li><li>Experience with Jenkins and Docker is a plus.</li><li>Experience with embedded Linux, Zephyr, or other real time operating systems is a plus.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Relevant Experience Required<br></u></strong><ul><li>5-7 years of experience developing C/C++ firmware applications and device drivers for low power designs. <br></li></ul><strong>MAJOR PHYSICAL DEMANDS<br></strong><ul><li>Standing: Occasional standing for work on complete control assemblies.</li><li>Lifting: Occasional lifting of controls and test equipment, less than 50 pounds.</li><li>Walking: Occasional walking throughout the facility.</li><li>Carrying: Occasional carrying of light objects.</li><li>Pushing: Infrequent pushing of objects, possibly related to rearrangement work.</li><li>Pulling: Infrequent pulling of objects, possibly related to rearrangement work.</li><li>Bending: Occasional bending during access to equipment.</li><li>Reaching: Infrequent reaching.</li><li>Handling: Frequent handling of parts or tools.</li><li>Environment: Frequent handling of parts or tools.<br></li></ul><strong>S &amp; C - TOP WORKPLACE<br></strong><ul><li>For 2019, S &amp; C Electric Company was named the 10th-best place to work among large employers in the Chicagoland area by The Chicago Tribune as part of the newspaper's prestigious annual Top Workplaces list.</li><li>For 2020, S &amp; C Electric was named as the 15th-Best Workplace in Chicago Tribune’s 11th Annual Report.</li><li>For 2021, S &amp; C Electric was named Among Top 2021 Workplaces in the United States by Top Workplaces USA, the nation’s most credible employer-recognition program.</li></ul>
industry: Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing, Renewable Energy Semiconductor Manufacturing, and Utilities

title: Firmware Engineer
description: <ul><li>Looking for a new Testing position?*</li><li>I have the one for you!* My client is currently hiring for an on-site Test Engineer with experience in the automotive industry. This team is responsible for developing custom proprietary vehicle diagnostic and data acquisition tools used to test off-highway vehicles. Most of this role will be in CAN data with a portion of bench level testing, you may be required from time to time to build your own custom harness to modify harnesses and writing diagrams. Experience with software testing, bug identification, and electrical testing is a must!</li><li>Description:*</li><li>Configure, test and install data acquisition devices and related hardware on Agricultural Machinery:</li><li>This activity would involve using software to configure data acquisition devices, various sensors, CSM Modules etc, build/modify existing harnesses to connect the device and sensors to the specific machinery, test them on bench setup, verify for proper configuration and data quality, ship/install the data acquisition devices securely on the machinery. Write detailed documents showing installation and data downloading procedure.</li><li>Support in data analysis process:</li><li>This task includes specific actions related to data analysis process (Download data from the DAQ devices, data conversion, monitoring data quality, transferring data to a server(AZURE). It might also include analyzing data using NI DIAdem software. Prepare detailed PPT's of analysis and present it to relevant groups.</li><li>Test and validation:</li><li>Includes test and validation of telemetry platform new and existing features.</li><li>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications:*</li><li>BS in Electrical Engineering or similar</li><li>Strong experience testing software and hardware</li><li>Must have experience with finding bugs in Software</li><li>Experience with electrical based testing with test tools</li><li>MUST have experience with CANalyzer, CAN or Vector Test tools</li><li>Must have automotive or similar industry experience</li><li>C++ and Python</li><li>Experience Level:* Junior to Mid Level<br><br></li></ul>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. title: Software Project Engineer
description: If you are a current Chamberlain Group employee, please click here to apply through your Workday account.<p><br></p>This role is responsible for applying basic knowledge to the design and development of embedded applications on hardware platforms. The focus in this role includes creation of technical specifications, application firmware design and development, and support for manufacturing and regulatory approval. Knowledge of basic software development practices and principles is required. An Engineer 2, Firmware must support their peers in day-to-day development activities and be able to troubleshoot platform defects of limited complexity. This role will be responsible for both individual and team based software development activities<p><br></p>Job Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Design, develop, and implement application level firmware solutions to meet business needs</li><li>Work with stakeholders to understand functional requirements of systems to accurately develop designs, implementations and test cases</li><li>Design and develop application firmware using best practices that adhere to product specifications using an Agile development process</li><li>Create and maintain technical specifications as related to product development</li><li>Work with senior engineers to implement scalable designs and modular functional blocks that meet product requirements</li><li>Use design analysis techniques such as FMEA or rate monotonic analysis to validate software designs prior to implementation. Ability to accurately document an intended design is critical</li><li>Create unit test cases that accurately test interface functionality and responses to varied inputs both in and out of scope</li><li>Analyze, troubleshoot, and resolve firmware defects as found during bench, lab, and production QA testing</li><li>Apply software quality tools such as Lint, Understand, and other static and dynamic analysis tools to verify software releases meet quality and coding standards</li><li>Support regulatory engineering for FCC and other outside agency approval of end products</li><li>Support manufacturing on site during as needed for engineering and production builds</li><li>Manage own work to deliver according to project schedules; be accountable for delivery</li><li>Actively contribute to the adoption of software architecture, best practices, and technologies</li><li>Responsible for complying with the security requirements set forth by the Information Security team and the established ISO 27001 Security Roles, Responsibilities, and Authorities Document found in the ISMS Document Library</li><li>Comply with health and safety guidelines and rules; managers should also ensure compliance across their teams</li><li>Protect Chamberlain Group’s reputation by keeping information confidential</li><li>Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reading professional publications, establishing personal networks, and participating in professional societies</li><li>Contribute to the team effort by accomplishing related results and participating on projects as needed</li></ul><p><br></p>Job Requirements:<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in computer engineering, computer science, electrical engineering, related technical field or equivalent practical experience</li><li>An advanced degree in directly applicable area of study may substitute for up to two (2) years of experience</li><li>1+ years of job-related experience as defined in the Essential Duties and Responsibilities</li><li>Able to travel up to 10% - domestically and internationally</li></ul><p><br></p>Preferred Job Requirements:<p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to work within cross functional teams to create electro-mechanical products; strong analytical skills; effective communication skills; Oriented programming experience; TCP, UPD, HTTP, WebSockets, MQTT, or other connected protocols</li><li>Agile/Scrum experience</li></ul><p><br></p>We're an organization who values its human capital and provides support to assist its employees succeed.<p><br></p>Chamberlain Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. You will be considered for this position based upon your experience and education, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, ancestry; marital, disabled or veteran status. We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce environment that is free from any form of discriminations or harassment.<p><br></p>Persons with disabilities who anticipate needing accommodations for any part of the application process may contact, in confidence Recruiting@Chamberlain.com.<p><br></p>NOTE: Staffing agencies, headhunters, recruiters, and/or placement agencies, please do not contact our hiring managers via email or phone or other methods.

title: Firmware Engineer II

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description: Take your career to the next level as an embedded software engineer, using your expertise in embedded C and MATLAB/Simulink to develop advanced features for the off-highway autonomous vehicle industry and push the technology of flagship vehicles such as tractors, harvesters, combines, and excavators to the next level.<br><ul><li>Your Responsibilities:*</li><li>Design, develop, and test software for enterprise programming and infrastructure solutions</li><li>Operate in a scrum team environment on varying project scope and direction from a project lead</li><li>Support the team with concept, development and testing of solutions</li><li>Software:*</li><li>Embedded C/C++</li><li>MATLAB/Simulink</li><li>Qualifications:*</li><li>Demonstrated capability in software product development using C++, C, Python and scripting languages</li><li>Training or experience with Object-Oriented Analysis/Design (OOA/D) and multi-threaded systems</li><li>Experience that demonstrates you are a self-starter, and able to work well without close direction</li><li>Demonstrated capability performing in an engineering team environment and interfacing with engineers and personnel of other disciplines</li><li>Minimum of 2 years of software industry experience<br><br></li></ul>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. title: Software Engineer - Low-Level Device Driver
description: If you are a current Chamberlain Group employee, please click here to apply through your Workday account.<p><br></p>At Chamberlain Group (CG), we hire smart, creative people to work on next-gen products for a connected world. We are passionate technologists with bold ideas and diverse perspectives. Our Engineering teams—spanning mechanical, firmware, machine learning and AI, cloud, and mobile technologies and more—reinvent access by combining hardware with cutting-edge, cloud-based solutions to create a safer, smarter customer experience. At CG, we encourage flexibility, fun, and a healthy work/life balance, including remote options.<p><br></p>Group is a global leader in access solutions with top brands, such as LiftMaster and Chamberlain, found in millions of homes, businesses, and communities worldwide. As a leader in the Smart Home industry, we boast one of the largest IoT install bases, with innovative products consisting of cameras, locks, card readers, garage door openers, gates and more, all powered by our myQ digital ecosystem.<p><br></p>This role is responsible for applying skilled knowledge of engineering principles and practices in engineering to support NPD, sustaining, and productivity designs that have limited complexity. This role will be heavily involved in developing test procedures, test strategies, outlining test automation initiatives, and some understanding of the principles in reliability testing.<p><br></p><strong>Job Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Responsible for creating, maintaining, and executing test plans on hardware and software of Chamberlain products</li><li>Estimating test effort, analyzing, and communicating test results, tracking defects, and participating in gauge R&amp;R studies</li><li>Participates as a key core team member on new product development teams, along with productivity and sustaining projects, attends design reviews, and day-to-day Agile scrum activities</li><li>Works with regulatory engineers to set-up and conduct test plans for UL agency-type testing.</li><li>Prepares and reviews test reports for projects and assists other TEs with their projects.</li><li>Directs the operation of a variety of computer automated and manual test equipment including data acquisition systems, environmental chambers, RF chambers, acoustics chambers, EMC test equipment, electrical test instrumentation, vibration systems, and assorted measurement transducers.</li><li>Evaluates the results of EMC testing of RF emissions, RF sensitivity, radiated and conducted immunity, and RF electrical safety evaluation.</li><li>Participate in defect analysis, root cause analysis, study product functionality impact, and provide key insight of observed product performance and defects.</li><li>Works with Manager to establish new test procedures, testing methodologies, and provides input for custom test fixture design and automation projects.</li><li>Comply with health and safety guidelines and rules; managers should also ensure compliance across their teams</li><li>Protect CGI’s reputation by keeping information confidential</li><li>Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, professional publications, establishing personal networks, and participating in professional societies</li><li>Contribute to the team effort by accomplishing related results and participating on projects as needed</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Requirements: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in engineering and minimum of three (3) years of job-related experience strongly preferred; or minimum of seven (7) years of job-related experience as defined in the Essential Duties &amp; Responsibilities; an advanced degree in directly applicable area of study may substitute for up to two (2) years of experience</li><li>3+ years of job-related experience with Bachelor’s degree in engineering</li><li>Able to travel up to 10% - domestically and internationally</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Job Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>LIMS software experience; Six Sigma Yellow Belt certification; familiarity with general MS Office applications such as Word, Excel, Visio, and Project</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to work within cross-functional teams to facilitate the creation of electro-mechanical products; analytical skills to support design creation of electro-mechanical systems by completing calculations involving statics, confidence and reliability testing, technical writing, and laying out Gantt and flow charts; conducting Anova GRR; good presentation skills; strong analytical skills</li></ul><p><br></p>We're an organization who values its human capital and provides support to assist its employees succeed.<p><br></p>Chamberlain Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. You will be considered for this position based upon your experience and education, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, ancestry; marital, disabled or veteran status. We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce environment that is free from any form of discriminations or harassment.<p><br></p>Persons with disabilities who anticipate needing accommodations for any part of the application process may contact, in confidence Recruiting@Chamberlain.com.<p><br></p>NOTE: Staffing agencies, headhunters, recruiters, and/or placement agencies, please do not contact our hiring managers via email or phone or other methods.

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description: SharePoint and Power Platform Developer, Chicago, IL We are looking for Microsoft 365, Office 365, SharePoint and Power Platform Developer and Administrator to join an IT Digital Workplace team.<p><br></p>An ideal SharePoint and Power Platform Developer will have diverse years of experience covering Architecture, Development, Implementation and Administration.<p><br></p>We would like to hire a professional with a track record of continuous improvement and delivering impactful projects and enhancements.<p><br></p>This position will work closely with business and IT teams for work related to design, development, and administration of M365 applications, including experience in SharePoint, Power apps, OneDrive, support, and software migrations.<p><br></p>This position is hybrid 3 days a week Onsite and 2 days a week Remote and candidates need to be local in or near Chicago. SharePoint and Power Platform Developer Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Develop procedures to maintain and administer SharePoint environments, including daily monitoring, troubleshooting, and performance analysis.- Design, implement, and configure SharePoint application end-to-end to meet the firm’s business needs and provide solutions to critical architectural and firm-level issues.- Design, develop, implement, and provide maintenance within Power Platform and other M365 applications.- Lead the integration and migration (write scripts) of content from various platforms.- Design custom applications to automate or simplify tasks.- Code, test, debug and document software solutions using appropriate processes, tools, frameworks, libraries, patterns, best practices, and standards.- Troubleshoot any SharePoint issues at the server side, user side, and network issues.- Drive escalation calls for P1 issues and troubleshoot.- Write PowerShell scripts for repetitive tasks, new installations, upgrades, and migrations.- Create infrastructure diagrams.- Troubleshoot connectivity issues due to firewall, load balancer, proxy, and others. SharePoint and Power Platform Developer Qualifications:</li><li>College Degree required.- 2-7 years of experience with SharePoint Development required.- Need Data Migration experience.- Experience with SharePoint 2013, 2016, 2018 and SharePoint Online.- Experience with Active Directory, Load Balancer, DNS, PowerShell, Azure DevOps, IIS, HTML, Java, and Web Logic.- Experience in development and .NET platform (C#, ASP.NET, and PowerShell).- Experience administering cloud technologies such as Azure and AWS.- Thorough understanding and experience with PowerShell scripting for administration tasks.- Knowledge of Web Services and Services Oriented Architecture.- Experience working with Windows servers, including Active Directory.- A proactive attitude to platform enhancements.- Keen attention to detail and excellent organizational skills.- Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate in both technical and non-technical language.- Excellent people skills (outgoing, approachable, motivated to help), including the ability to train end users.- Ability to work independently or as part of a team.- Ability to produce technical and functional documentation.- Ability to troubleshoot and perform unit testing based on scenarios.- Aptitude for continuous learning.- Must be able to read, write, and speak fluent English.- Experience with NetDocuments (NetDocs) is a plus. Keywords:</li></ul><p><br></p>Chicago IL Jobs, SharePoint and Power Platform Developer, SharePoint, Active Directory, Load Balancers, DNS, PowerShell, AWS, Azure, DevOps, IIS, HTML, Java, WebLogic, .Net, C#, Windows Server, Microsoft 365, Office 365, NetDocuments, NetDocs, Data Migration, Programmer, Programmer Analyst, Software Engineer, Software Developer, Chicago Recruiters, Information Technology Jobs, IT Jobs, Chicago Recruiting Looking to hire a SharePoint and Power Platform Developer in Chicago, IL or in other cities?<p><br></p>Our IT recruiting agencies and staffing companies can help. We help companies that are looking to hire SharePoint and Power Platform Developers for jobs in Chicago, Illinois and in other cities too.<p><br></p>Please contact our IT recruiting agencies and IT staffing companies today! SharePoint and Power Platform Developer<p><br></p><ul><li>M</li></ul>

Candidate will be creating, maintaining and executing automation test plans, writing code against software platforms, estimating testing efforts, analysing and communicating test results, defect tracking and participation in day-to-day acceptance test activities, and contribute to the company's performance and scalability testing efforts.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collaborating with others to deliver complex projects which may involve multiple systems</li><li>Continuously thinking about the next steps while improving yourself and others around you</li><li>Contribute to our long-term vision and strategy for improved quality via automation</li><li>Develop, enhance and extend automation frameworks</li><li>Identify quality tasks during team sprint cycle and implement automation for new features</li><li>Analyze and communicate test results and defect tracking</li><li>Participate in performance and load test efforts</li><li>Assist in the planning, creation and control of the test environments and test data</li><li>Define test strategy, conduct requirements analysis for testability, identify scope, conduct risk and mitigation planning, configuration management planning, write master and detailed test plans for test planning and design.</li><li>Participate in the review of acceptance test procedures and processes and provide recommendations for improvements to eliminate redundancies in testing and improve efficiency.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the primary functions.</li><li>BS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field or equivalent experience</li><li>3+ years of technical experience building automated solutions within regulated industries</li><li>1+ years of within a leadership or senior role on cross-functional engineering teams</li><li>Experience working in an Agile environment</li><li>Hands-on experience with writing automation test code and utilizing leading industry standards tools and frameworks that can simulate complex multi-system scenarios</li><li>Proficiency with automated testing types (Unit, Functional, Load, Security, Behavioral, Integration, Component, Contract and End to End)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Technical Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Proficiency with automated testing types (Unit, Functional, Load, Security, Behavioral, Integration, Component, Contract and End to End)</li><li>Experience working with two or more of the following: web/mobile application development, Unix/Linux environments, event driven systems, transaction processing systems, distributed and parallel systems, large software systems development, security software development, public-cloud platforms</li><li>Automated Testing framework experience (Cucumber, Selenium, Mocha/Chai, TestNG)</li><li>BS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field or equivalent experience</li><li>3+ years of technical experience building automated solutions within regulated industries</li><li>1+ years of within a leadership or senior role on cross-functional engineering teams</li><li>Excellent Oral and written communication skills</li><li>Java based software development experience</li><li>Fluent in object-oriented design, industry best practices, software patterns, and architecture principles</li><li>Automated testing framework experience</li><li>Financial markets work experience, knowledge of trade and settlement life cycle.</li></ul>

title: RPG As400 Programmer
description: STRATEGIC STAFFING SOLUTIONS (S3) HAS AN OPENING!<p><br></p>S3 is seeking a OpenText Exstream Developer for one of our partners in the Finance industry! This role is ONSITE in the Chicago, IL area (Riverwoods). Ideal candidates must also have experience with Mainframe and Unix. Not open to Corp to Corp candidates. Job Title: OpenText Exstream Developer (Onsite) Location: Chicago, IL (60015) Role Type: W2 Only, No C2C Contract Length: 3 months contract-to-hire Pay: $55-68/hr. How to Apply: Please send resume and contact information to Keena Leo, Sourcing Specialist, at and reference job #225992.JOB DESCRIPTION/RESPONSIBILITIES:Develop and maintain mainframe solutions to fit business needs.Develop and maintain mainframe application.Develop and maintain back-end systems.Work with key stakeholders to design complex solutions and lead from inception to production.Create and maintain DevOps processes, application infrastructure, and utilize cloud services (including database systems and models).Innovate on and advocate for best practices and improved team processes.Mentor junior team members.Work directly with business partners to understand business requirements.Work independently or with own team to innovate and advocate for best practices within the team.Design complex solutions and lead them from inception to production within the Agile team.REQUIRED SKILLS/QUALIFICATIONS:Experience in customer communications application related software of OpenText Exstream, Mainframe and Unix a must.High degree of understanding of business and technical creation of statements, disclosures, letters, checks, and claims processes.Familiar with Agile framework.High degree of understanding of banking processes. This includes lines of business of deposits products, personal loans, student loans and home equity loans.Within each line of business an understanding of the processes related to originations, disbursements, servicing, payments, collections, and recovery.Effectively communicate and collaborate within the department and across the organization by proactively driving solutions related to communication system issues and escalating as neededThe S3 DifferenceThe global mission of S3 is to build trusting relationships and deliver solutions that positively impact our customers, our consultants, and our communities.<p><br></p>The four pillars of our company are to:Set the bar high for what a company should doCreate jobsOffer people an opportunity to succeed and change their station in lifeImprove the communities where we live and work through volunteering and charitable givingAs an S3 employee, you’re eligible for a full benefits package that may include:Medical InsuranceDental InsuranceVision Insurance401(k) PlanVacation PackageLife &amp; Disability Insurance PlansFlexible Spending AccountsTuition Reimbursement

title: .NET Software Engineer – Chicago
description: Hi,<p><br></p>Hope you’re staying safe and healthy! I sourced your profile from one of the job boards while looking for <strong>“</strong><strong>Java Developer”</strong>. I feel that you’d be a good fit for the position I’m currently recruiting for. So, I’m writing to you in regard to an exciting role we have available with one of our clients, for the position of <strong>“</strong><strong>Java Developer”</strong> based out of <strong>Chicago IL 60603</strong>.<p><br></p>Here’s the detailed job description for your reference. Please have a look at it and let me know your thoughts. If interested, please send me your updated resume, and feel free to reach me at <strong>703-468-1406</strong> . Or let me know what time works best for you so we can further discuss this in detail.<p><br></p><strong>Job Title: </strong><strong>Java Developer</strong><p><br></p><strong>Location: Chicago IL 60603</strong><p><br></p><strong>Type: Contract To Hire</strong><p><br></p><strong>Roles and Responsibilities: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree (or equivalent experience) in Computer Science/Engineering</li><li>2+ years of experience in Java backend development and framework such as Java/J2EE/Java Sprint Boots</li><li>Experience with unit testing such as junit</li><li>Must have Solid understanding of object oriented, multi-thread design methodologies and J2EE design patterns</li><li>1+ years of experience in relational database experience such as Oracle or PostgreSQL</li><li>Advanced knowledge of application, data and infrastructure architecture disciplines. </li><li>Understanding of architecture and design across all systems</li><li>Knowledge of industry wide technology trends and best practices</li><li>Ability to work in large, collaborative teams to achieve organizational goals, and passionate about building an innovative culture</li><li>Working proficiency in developmental toolsets such as Ant, Maven, Gradle, Git, Jenkins</li><li>Experience in troubleshooting issues</li><li>Good communication skills</li><li>Able to organize and handle technical discussion with architects and Sr. Leaders</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Desired:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Working proficiency with micro-services architecture</li><li>Exposure to Kubernetes, Kafka messaging,</li><li>Exposure to AWS cloud services like Aurora PostgreSQL, EKS, IAM etc</li></ul><p><br></p>Pay Range: $40-$80<p><br></p>The specific compensation for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role as well as the cost of labor in the market; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. Our full-time consultants have access to benefits including medical, dental, vision as well as 401K contributions.

description: <ul><li>NET Software Engineer, .NET 7, C# – Consultancy – Chicago</li></ul><p><br></p>(Tech stack: .NET Software Engineer, .NET 7, ASP.NET, C#, React, Angular 14, Microservices, Vue.js, TypeScript, Azure, Web API 2, Agile, SQL Server 2022, Programmer, Full Stack Developer, Architect, .NET Software Engineer)<p><br></p>Our client is an award winning Microsoft consultancy. They specialise in delivering innovative .NET technology based business solutions to investment banks, financial services companies, prestigious music/media label and many more. They are about to embark on one of the most ambitious .NET development projects since the birth of the .NET framework.<p><br></p>We are seeking several .NET Software Engineer with an extensive array of talent and expertise. .NET Software Engineer will be given complete ownership of your business area and the opportunity to work on the full project life cycle. .NET Software Engineer applicants should have a skill set that encompasses some or all of the following: .NET, .NET Core / ASP.NET MVC, C# and SQL Server. Knowledge of software development methodologies is of interest (Agile, Scrum). HTML5, CSS3, jQuery, JSON, Bootstrap</li> <li> Software Design Principles and Software Design Patterns</li> <li> MS SQL Server 2012 and above</li> <li> Creating unit test scripts in Protractor/Karma/Jasmine</li> <li> Agile process, Good understanding on DevOps</li> <li> Secondary Skills / Good to have - Azure DevOps/Jira; Jenkins/Deployment pipeline scripting exposure. PowerShell.</li></ul>

title: .Net Architect
description: Cognizant’s Digital Engineering practice is seeking a highly qualified Sr. Java FSD with experience developing and building high-performing, scalable, enterprise applications. You will be part of a digital software team that works on high-demand applications. Our engineers have a passion for high-quality, reliable and maintainable code. You will work side by side with product managers, designers, and clients, making decisions together in order to quickly deliver valuable working software to clients and their users. Our engineers are agile and retrospective, and not afraid to identify what we’re doing wrong, so we can fix it, and what we’re doing right, so we can improve on it. Above all, we judge success by the success of our team and the happiness of our customers.<br><br><strong>Cognizant Digital Engineering </strong>If you’re like us, you’ve got big ideas. At Cognizant, we’re exploring new ideas every day. We help industry leading companies reinvent their business models and innovate products that create new value—by connecting people with things, insights and experiences. Cognizant digital engineering designs, engineers and delivers digital products and experiences that drive digital-first business models. We offer the most comprehensive digital engineering expertise and client-centric methodology for sustainable innovation.<br><br>Location<strong>: Chicago, IL and Forth Mill, SC or Remote<br></strong><ul><li>You must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future**<br></li></ul><strong>Cognizant will not sponsor H-1B or other U.S. work authorization for this role.<br><br></strong><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Convert monolith applications into microservices and scale out the services based on Memory &amp; CPU Utilization.</li><li> Create UI modules and integrate with backend service</li><li> Participate in backlog grooming and raise new tasks for each cycle.</li><li> Develop Java web-based applications using Java/J2EE, Spring IOC, Spring MVC, Spring AOP, Spring Security, Spring Boot, JDBC, Web Services &amp; ORM frameworks like Hibernate.</li><li> Develop Unit Tests Scenarios, Integration testing, Performance Testing &amp; participate in verification of features to maintain a high-quality software code repository</li><li> Updating web service features according to business needs or change of requirements.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li> Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering or Quantitative Finance is required, or in lieu, a demonstrated equivalence in work experience.</li><li> 5+ Years of development experience with Java/J2EE.</li><li> Experience with Spring IOC, MVC, AOP, Security, Boot, JDBC, webservices and ORM frameworks like Hibernate.</li><li> 5 to 10 years of IT experience in application development and support.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Salary And Other Compensation<br><br></u></strong>The annual salary for this position is between $99,000.00 – 130,000.00 depending on experience and other qualifications of the successful candidate.<br><br>This position is also eligible for Cognizant’s discretionary annual incentive program, based on performance and subject to the terms of Cognizant’s applicable plans.<br><br><strong>Benefits</strong>: Cognizant offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements:<br><br>Medical/Dental/Vision/Life Insurance<br><br>Paid holidays plus Paid Time Off<br><br>401(k) plan and contributions<br><br>Long-term/Short-term Disability<br><br>Paid Parental Leave<br><br>Employee Stock Purchase Plan<br><br><strong>Disclaimer:</strong> The salary, other compensation, and benefits information is accurate as of the date of this posting. Cognizant reserves the right to modify this information at any time, subject to applicable law.<br><br><strong>Why Choose Cognizant?<br><br></strong>It takes a lot to succeed in today’s fast-paced market, and Cognizant Technology Solutions has become a leader in the industry. We love big ideas and even bigger dreams! We stand out because we put human experiences at the core. Our associates enjoy robust benefits and training opportunities from our industry-recognized, award-winning Academy team. You will have access to hundreds of technical trainings to keep your skillsets fresh and have opportunities to acquire certifications on the newest technologies.<br><br>Everything we do at Cognizant we do with passion—for our clients (fortune 100 companies), our communities, and our organization. It’s the defining attribute that we look for in our people.<br><br>If you love ambiguity, excited by change, and excel through autonomy, we’d love to hear from you!<br><br><strong><u>About Cognizant Digital Engineering<br><br></u></strong>Well-designed software transcends digital technology, going beyond the fulfillment of basic requirements to focus instead on human needs. Within Cognizant Digital Engineering, we help clients develop software products that transform human insights into tangible, production-ready digital solutions. We also work with our clients to scale their native cloud applications. Using insights from the lived experiences of our consumers, we seamlessly replace traditional service strategies with engaging, precise, and direct digital applications. Designing phenomenal software is vital to success in the digital economy—and we understand that a human-centric approach is key to this design.<br><br>www.cognizant.com<br><br><strong>NASDAQ: CTSH <br><br></strong><strong><u>About Cognizant<br><br></u></strong>Headquartered in the U.S, Cognizant is a member of the S&amp;P-500, Nasdaq-100, Fortune 200, and was recently ranked as the #1 Fastest Growing “All Star” by Fortune Magazine. Cognizant uses a highly flexible business model, a detailed global delivery network, and deep domain expertise to deliver to a long list of best-in-class companies that are leaders in their own space.<br><br>Cognizant is recognized as a Military Friendly Employer and is a coalition member of the Veteran Jobs Mission. Our Cognizant Veterans Network assists Veterans in building and growing a career at Cognizant that allows them to demonstrate the leadership, loyalty, integrity, and commitment to quality instilled in them through participation in military service.<br><br>Cognizant is an equal opportunity employer provider and committed to creating a diverse environment. Cognizant considers all applicants without regard to race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, age, and marital status, disabilities, sexual orientation or preference, veteran status, or any other classification protected by state, federal, or local law.<br><br>IND123<br><br>Job Location : Chicago, Illinois, United States || Fort Mill, South Carolina, United States<br><br>Employee Status : Full Time Employee<br><br>Shift : Day Job<br><br>Travel : No<br><br>Job Posting : May 15 2023<br><br><strong><u>About Cognizant<br><br></u></strong>Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 185 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @USJobsCognizant.<br><br>Applicants may be required to attend interviews in person or by video conference. In addition, candidates may be required to present their current state or government issued ID during each interview.<br><br>Cognizant is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.<br><br>If you have a disability that requires a reasonable accommodation to search for a job opening or submit an application, please email CareersNA2@cognizant.com with your request and contact information.<br><br>

title: Azure Dotnet Appdev Architect
description: <strong>Test Manager<br><br></strong><strong><u>Qualification<br><br></u></strong>Graduate (Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or in “STEM” Majors (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math) or related field)<br><br><strong><u>Responsibility<br><br></u></strong><strong>Test Requirement Analysis</strong>:<br><ul><li></li><li> Create/modify/review Master Test Strategy docuement for large engagements.</li><li></li><li> Create/update/review Test Estimations, Project/ Sprint Planning effort.</li><li></li><li> Leverage previous project experience/learning like Retrospection Report, Lesson Learnt for better requirement analysis.</li><li></li><li> Review architecture &amp; design work products by adopting White Box testing techniques to identify defects by leveraging predefined checklist and cognizant solution accelerators(if any).<br></li></ul><strong><u>Test Strategy And Test Planning<br></u></strong><ul><li> * Create test strategy (that includes release date, types of testing, scope of the project, detail explanation of particular release, RAID Risk, Assumptions, Issues and Dependencies etc).</li><li> * Gather inputs from the client (eg Types of testing, Development teams, Client managers etc).</li><li> * Prepare test plan covering timelines, resource (Man /Machine) deployment (How it will be tested).</li><li> * Seek signoff on the test plan.</li><li></li><li> Involve Project/ Sprint Planning to define the sprint goals, scrum review meetings, identify the product backlogs &amp; provide risks/issues to scrum team for quicker remediation.</li><li></li><li> Review &amp; seek signoff from customer on Retrospection Report, Lesson Learnt for every release.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Test Design Techniques (Design Principles/tools/patterns)<br></u></strong><ul><li></li><li> Review the test scenarios and seek review as required.</li><li> Track the root cause of the review comments and take actions to resolve them.</li><li></li><li> Review the test cases and traceability matrix to ensure total coverage of requirements.</li><li></li><li> Track the downtime and report the same to the client.</li><li></li><li> Support the team/ client in conducting UAT/BUT if applicable.</li><li></li><li> Perform sanity testing to ensure system readiness for testing.</li><li> Upload the test cases.</li><li></li><li> Validate readiness of the test environment for test execution.</li><li> Prepare test lab for test execution.</li><li></li><li> Seek sign off from the client at various stages of the cycle as required.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Only For Onsite Coordinator<br></u></strong><ul><li></li><li> Support Business Lead at client side to perform UAT.</li><li> If requested identify the test data for UAT.</li><li></li><li> Create Run Plan document that captures priority of test cases based on complexity.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Coding Practices &amp; Defect Management<br></u></strong><ul><li></li><li> Posses holistic view of quality Domain, User experience, Black box, White box testing.</li><li></li><li> Able to estimate and commit task level effort and deliver activities on time.</li><li></li><li> Review the defects logged by team and assign it to the right owner.</li><li></li><li> Effective technical communication by participating in architectural/design reviews.</li><li></li><li> Speak the developer language.</li><li></li><li> Support Quality Assurance goals.</li><li></li><li> Adhere to all customer standards, policies and governance practices.</li><li></li><li> Comprehensive understanding of full development lifecycle and is actively involved in all phases.</li><li> * Involvement with development teams, architects early in the project life cycle to identify the dependencies on architecture design, low level design components &amp; coding standards, test data dependencies, environment dependencies etc.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Test Execution (Automation/Specialized Testing)<br></u></strong><ul><li></li><li> Design &amp; implement bestinclass automation framework based on AUT.</li><li></li><li> Review the test results and clarify doubts/query raised by team during execution.</li><li></li><li> Prepare Test summary Report and share the same for review/ Review the test results/test reports submitted by the test analyst.</li><li></li><li> Capture lessons learnt and the best practices adopted.</li><li></li><li> Periodically generate metrics based on the audience.</li><li></li><li> Review metrics to identify areas for process optimization.</li><li></li><li> Create robust test automation scripts.</li><li></li><li> Web Services Design the Web Services testing framework.</li><li></li><li> DevOps Define, deploy &amp; monitoring metrics configuration.</li><li></li><li> Has expert knowledge of multithreading &amp; other QE tools &amp; technology.</li><li> * Discussion with the development, release &amp; deployment team stakeholders to make gono go decision based on test results and test closure summary report.</li><li> * Possess specialist knowlege on Continous integration/deployment &amp; delivery using industry best tools &amp; technologies.</li><li> * Perform Frequent monitoring &amp; Failure analysis will be done.</li><li> * Perform Script fixing for any errors/issues.</li><li> * Status is shared to onsite across all teams.</li><li> * Frequent Optimization /Maintenance.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Technology Consulting Research &amp; Analysis<br></u></strong><ul><li></li><li> Participate in quality, design decisions for automations, stability, usability &amp; scalability of application under test.</li><li></li><li> Code quality , coverage &amp; productivity analysis to ensure all areas of program are exercised by test suites.<br></li></ul><strong><u>People Management<br></u></strong><ul><li> * Organize the boot camp for new entrants.</li><li></li><li> Develop and sustain positive relationships with peers.</li><li> * Identify training needs of team members.</li><li> * Identify, groom, reward and develop high performers.</li><li> * Resolve escalated conflicts and grievances.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Knowledge &amp; Innovation Management<br></u></strong><ul><li> * Mentor/coach the team to create knowledge artefacts (eg collaterals, reusable assets) to drive knowledge management.</li><li> * Improvise already existing processes based on the experience.</li><li> * Institutionalize systems and processes in place to implement innovation suggestion made by the team (eg adoption of Cognizant proprietary best practices / tools, process optimization like usage of tools, automation, etc ).</li><li> * Identify the time and cost savings made due to adoption of the best practices.</li><li> * Create condusive environment for team members to innovate &amp; share ideas.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Project, Configuration &amp; Release Management<br></u></strong><ul><li></li><li> Review the daily deliverables and share it with the stakeholders appropriately.</li><li></li><li> Create and share weekly status reports and daily status reports with the team/ relevant stakeholders.</li><li></li><li> Facilitate calls between onsite and offshore teams to discuss the project status.</li><li></li><li> Identify resources based on the estimation and required skill set.</li><li> (Only For Maintenance/Enhancements Project).</li><li></li><li> Create estimation for enhancements based on the understanding of requirement.</li><li></li><li> Perform POCs on the tools (eg accelerators, performance enhancers ) if required.</li><li></li><li> Coordinate with the release manager to keep abreast with the various activities in the test environment (eg build schedule) and to ensure the right components move to the production.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Must Have Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>Microservices</li><li>Cucumber</li><li>Java</li><li>Selenium<br></li></ul>Employee Status : Full Time Employee<br><br>Shift : Day Job<br><br>Travel : No<br><br>Job Posting : May 03 2023<br><br><strong><u>About Cognizant<br><br></u></strong>Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 185 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @USJobsCognizant.<br><br>Applicants may be required to attend interviews in person or by video conference. In addition, candidates may be required to present their current state or government issued ID during each interview.<br><br>Cognizant is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.<br><br>If you have a disability that requires a reasonable accommodation to search for a job opening or submit an application, please email CareersNA2@cognizant.com with your request and contact information.

delivery using industry best tools &amp; technologies.</li><li> * Perform Frequent monitoring &amp; Failure analysis will be done.</li><li> * Perform Script fixing for any errors/issues.</li><li> * Status is shared to onsite across all teams.</li><li> * Frequent Optimization /Maintenance.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Technology Consulting Research &amp; Analysis<br></u></strong><ul><li></li><li> Participate in quality, design decisions for automations, stability, usability &amp; scalability of application under test.</li><li></li><li> Code quality , coverage &amp; productivity analysis to ensure all areas of program are exercised by test suites.<br></li></ul><strong><u>People Management<br></u></strong><ul><li> * Organize the boot camp for new entrants.</li><li></li><li> Develop and sustain positive relationships with peers.</li><li> * Identify training needs of team members.</li><li> * Identify, groom, reward and develop high performers.</li><li> * Resolve escalated conflicts and grievances.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Knowledge &amp; Innovation Management<br></u></strong><ul><li> * Mentor/coach the team to create knowledge artefacts (eg collaterals, reusable assets) to drive knowledge management.</li><li> * Improvise already existing processes based on the experience.</li><li> * Institutionalize systems and processes in place to implement innovation suggestion made by the team (eg adoption of Cognizant proprietary best practices / tools, process optimization like usage of tools, automation, etc ).</li><li> * Identify the time and cost savings made due to adoption of the best practices.</li><li> * Create condusive environment for team members to innovate &amp; share ideas.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Project, Configuration &amp; Release Management<br></u></strong><ul><li></li><li> Review the daily deliverables and share it with the stakeholders appropriately.</li><li></li><li> Create and share weekly status reports and daily status reports with the team/ relevant stakeholders.</li><li></li><li> Facilitate calls between onsite and offshore teams to discuss the project status.</li><li></li><li> Identify resources based on the estimation and required skill set.</li><li> (Only For Maintenance/Enhancements Project).</li><li></li><li> Create estimation for enhancements based on the understanding of requirement.</li><li></li><li> Perform POCs on the tools (eg accelerators, performance enhancers ) if required.</li><li></li><li> Coordinate with the release manager to keep abreast with the various activities in the test environment (eg build schedule) and to ensure the right components move to the production.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Must Have Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>Microservices</li><li>Cucumber</li><li>Java</li><li>Selenium<br></li></ul>Employee Status : Full Time Employee<br><br>Shift : Day Job<br><br>Travel : No<br><br>Job Posting : May 03 2023<br><br><strong><u>About Cognizant<br><br></u></strong>Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 185 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @USJobsCognizant.<br><br>Applicants may be required to attend interviews in person or by video conference. In addition, candidates may be required to present their current state or government issued ID during each interview.<br><br>Cognizant is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.<br><br>If you have a disability that requires a reasonable accommodation to search for a job opening or submit an application, please email CareersNA2@cognizant.com with your request and contact information.

title: Senior Java FSD (Remote)
description: If you are a current Chamberlain Group employee, please click here to apply through your Workday account.<p><br></p>At Chamberlain Group (CG), we hire smart, creative people to work on next-gen products for a connected world. We are passionate technologists with bold ideas and diverse perspectives. Our Engineering teams—spanning mechanical, firmware, machine learning and AI, cloud, and mobile technologies and more—reinvent access by combining hardware with cutting-edge, cloud-based solutions to create a safer, smarter customer experience. At CG, we encourage flexibility, fun, and a healthy work/life balance, including remote options.<p><br></p>Chamberlain Group is a global leader in access solutions with top brands, such as LiftMaster and Chamberlain, found in millions of homes, businesses, and communities worldwide. As a leader in the Smart Home industry, we boast one of the largest IoT install bases, with innovative products consisting of cameras, locks, card readers, garage door openers, gates and more, all powered by our myQ digital ecosystem.<p><br></p>This is a role within CGI's Engineering group. A successful incumbent is expected to lead quality assurance through test case development, test script / automation development and test execution for new features and regression testing of one or more of the following depending on assignment: mobile apps, web sites, middleware, IOT devices (such as Garage Door Openers, Commercial Access Controls, Video enabled products)<p><br></p><strong>Job Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Lead quality assurance through test case development, test script / automation development and test execution for new features and regression testing of one or more of the following depending on assignment: mobile apps, web sites, middleware, IOT devices (such as Garage Door Openers, Commercial Access Controls, Video enabled products)</li><li>Work with QE &amp; Dev team to define process and strategy associated with test automation, and implement best practices for testing of firmware, web, middleware, and mobile apps</li><li>Participate in Scrum, Daily Stand-up, Sprint and iterative development activities. Collaborate with agile team members, scrum master, developers and product owners to support quality assurance activities</li><li>Analyze user stories for new features and tickets assigned, develop test cases and automation, verify them, and support regression testing</li><li>Lead QE team in supporting quality assurance activities for assigned Scrum teams, projects</li><li>Responsible for test case and test script development / reviews, requirements traceability analysis.</li><li>Plan test schedules or strategies in accordance with project scope / delivery dates</li><li>Responsible for creation, execution, and maintenance of test plans</li><li>Manage complete scope of work assigned and coordinate with remote and external teams</li><li>Summarize test results. Provide accurate traceability and bug reports for Go/No-Go decisions</li><li>Responsible for complying with the security requirements set forth by the Information Security team and the established ISO 27001 Security Roles, Responsibilities, and Authorities Document found in the ISMS Document Library</li><li>Comply with health and safety guidelines and rules; managers should also ensure compliance across their teams</li><li>Protect CGI’s reputation by keeping information confidential</li><li>Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, professional publications, establishing personal networks, and participating in professional societies</li><li>Contribute to the team effort by accomplishing related results and participating on projects as needed</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related field, or equivalent practical experience</li><li>An advanced degree in directly applicable area of study may substitute for up to two (2) years of experience</li><li>3+ years experience in automation testing development</li><li>2+ years experience with test automation of web applications, middleware or firmware.</li><li>2+ years experience in Automation tools like Selenium, Appium, SoapUI, RestAssured</li><li>Hands on experience with implementing Continuous Integration and build automation systems such as Jenkins/ Bamboo/ Octopus etc.</li><li>Experience with Source Code Management Tools (e.g. Git, TFS, RTC)</li><li>Experience in test case development, test plans and test reports</li><li>Experience with Test Management, Bug Tracking, Collaboration tools (e.g. Testrail, Jira, Confluence)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Proficiency with one or more of the following programming languages/frameworks: C#, Java, Python, .NET/Java frameworks</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Job Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related field</li><li>Quality Assurance Certifications (e.g. ISTQB)</li><li>Coding Certifications</li><li>Cloud Certifications</li><li>2+ years experience with test automation of mobile applications, middleware or firmware.</li><li>1+ years experience in Automation testing of Cloud hosted applications, middleware</li><li>1+ years experience in agile testing</li><li>Hardware testing and automation experience</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience in TDD/BDD approaches and relevant tools such as cucumber</li><li>Experience in IOT domain</li></ul><p><br></p>We're an organization who values its human capital and provides support to assist its employees succeed.<p><br></p>Chamberlain Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. You will be considered for this position based upon your experience and education, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, ancestry; marital, disabled or veteran status. We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce environment that is free from any form of discriminations or harassment.<p><br></p>Persons with disabilities who anticipate needing accommodations for any part of the application process may contact, in confidence Recruiting@Chamberlain.com.<p><br></p>NOTE: Staffing agencies, headhunters, recruiters, and/or placement agencies, please do not contact our hiring managers via email or phone or other methods.

title: Manager - Projects
description: <strong>TITLE: Guidewire Business Analyst</strong><p><br></p><strong>LOCATION- Woodridge, IL / Remote</strong><p><br></p><strong>DURATION: 12 Months contract</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Hands-on experience with Guidewire ClaimCenter requirement gathering.<p><br></p>Through self- directed activities act as liaison between business user and technical groups, using superior communication skills to elicit, document, analyse and validate Experience operating and interfacing with business management, including negotiation and presentation skills<p><br></p>Proven track record of creating clear, concise deliverables that reflect a deep understanding of business needs and the out of the box software functionality of guidewire claimcenter Strong initiative; able to self-manage; comfortable with ambiguity and able to work through it to get the right things doneTechnical skills: Guidewire claimcenter SVN, Rally, Client-QC,Jira Microsoft - Project, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint Guidewire PolicyCenter/ BillingCenter/ ClaimCenter interfaces Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills Gathered, analysed documented business and technical requirements from both formal and informal sessions and validate the needs of the business stakeholders, thereby drafting the Technical Design Document (TDD) and System Specification Document (SSD).
